content_list.title: Dua after Azan
content_list.subtitle: Darood Sharif and Dua after Azan should be recited
content_list.content:
Narrated from Jabir bin Abdullah (RA), the Messenger of Allah peace be upon him, said:

Whoever recites the following dua after hearing the Azan will be entitled to my intercession on the Day of Resurrection. (The dua is:)

اَللّٰهُمَّ رَبَّ هٰذِهِ الدَّعْوَةِ التَّامَّةِ وَالصَّلاَةِ الْقَائِمَةِ آتِ مُحَمَّدًا الْوَسِيْلَةَ وَالْفَضِيْلَةَ وَابْعَثْهُ مَقَامًا مَّحْمُوْدًا الَّذِيْ وَعَدْتَهُ

Translation: O Allah, Lord of this complete call and established prayer, grant Muhammad the means and virtue, and raise him to the praised position that You have promised him.

(Bukhari 614)

content_list.title: Intention for Ablution
content_list.subtitle: Intent is to be made, not read. It is done in the mind, not recited
content_list.content: Intention means to make a wish, a resolution. When we enter the ablution room with the intention to purify ourselves, the intention for ablution is made. Nowhere in the Quran-Hadith is it mentioned that a specific verbal intention must be recited at the beginning of ablution. The words given in various books are created by Arabic speakers, not sourced from Hadith. Hence, considering the verbal recitation of those Arabic phrases at the beginning of ablution as obligatory or more rewarding or an essential part of religion is an innovation.

content_list.title: Dua at the Beginning of Ablution
content_list.subtitle: Reciting Bismillah at the beginning of ablution is Sunnah
content_list.content:
بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ

In the name of Allah.

Abu Dawud, no. 101; Ibn Majah, no. 397; Ahmad, no. 9418. See also, Irwa ul-Ghalil 1/122.

content_list.title: Dua after Completing Ablution
content_list.subtitle: Reciting Kalimatush Shahadah while looking at the sky is Sunnah
content_list.content:
Dua 1
---------------------

أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لَّا إِلٰهَ إِلَّا اللّٰهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيْكَ لَهُ وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُهُ وَرَسُوْلُهُ

I bear witness that none is worthy of worship but Allah alone, without partner, and I bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and Messenger.

Muslim 1/209, no. 234

Dua 2
---------------------

اَللّٰهُمَّ اجْعَلْنِيْ مِنَ التَّوَّابِيْنَ وَاجْعَلْنِيْ مِنَ الْمُتَطَهِّرِيْنَ

O Allah, make me from among those who repent and purify themselves.

Tirmidhi-1/78, no. 55

Dua 3
---------------------

سُبْحانَكَ اللّٰهُمَّ وَبِحَمْدِكَ، أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لَّا إِلٰهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ، أَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وَأَتُوْبُ إِلَيْكَ

Glory and praise be to You, O Allah. I bear witness that there is none worthy of worship but You. I seek Your forgiveness and return to You.

Nasai, Amalul Yawm Wal Laylah, p. 173. Also see, Irwa ul-Ghalil, 1/135, 3/94.

content_list.title: Dua and Sunnahs when Entering the Mosque
content_list.subtitle: Entering the mosque with the right foot, seeking refuge from Satan, reciting Darood upon the Prophet (SAW) is Sunnah
content_list.content:
Sunnahs of entering the mosque:

1. Saying Bismillah and Darood Sharif. Both can be read together like this:

بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ وَالصَّلَاةُ وَالسَّلَامُ عَلَى رَسُوْلِ اللّٰهِ

Meaning: In the name of Allah, I enter and blessings and peace be on the Messenger of Allah. [1] (A Hadith also mentions seeking refuge from Satan upon entering the mosque. The supplication described is:

أَعُوْذُ بِاللّٰهِ العَظِيْمِ، وَبِوَجْهِهِ الْكَرِيْمِ، وَسُلْطَانِهِ الْقَدِيْمِ، مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيْمِ

Meaning: I seek refuge in Allah, the Almighty, and in His Noble Face and His Eternal Power, from Satan, the Accursed. [2]

If you want to read this prayer, read it, then say Bismillah, and then the Darood Sharif.

2. Reading the supplication for entering the mosque.

اللّٰهُمَّ افْتَحْ لِيْ أَبْوَابَ رَحْمَتِكَ

O Allah, open for me the doors of Your mercy. [3]

3. Entering the mosque with the right foot. [4]

Reference:
[1] Ibnus Sunni, no. 8, Abu Dawood, no. 465.
[2] Abu Dawood, no. 466.
[3] Muslim 1/494, no. 713; in Sunan Ibn Majah there's a narration from Fatimah RA, اللّٰهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِيْ ذُنُوْبِيْ وافْتَحْ لِيْ أبْوَابَ رَحْمَتِكَ
“O Allah, forgive my sins and open for me the gates of Your mercy”. See, Ibn Majah, no. 771.
[4] Hakim 1/218; Baihaqi, 2/442.

content_list.title: Dua When Exiting the Mosque
content_list.subtitle: Exiting the mosque with the left foot is Sunnah
content_list.content:
Exit the mosque with the left foot [1] and say,

بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ وَالصّلَاةُ وَالسَّلَامُ عَلَى رَسُوْلِ اللّٰهِ، اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ فَضْلِك، اللّٰهُمَّ اعْصِمْنِيْ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيْمِ،

Meaning: In the name of Allah, I leave. Peace and blessings be upon the Messenger of Allah. O Allah, I ask You for Your grace. O Allah, protect me from Satan, the accursed. [2]

[1] Al-Hakim, 1/218; Baihaqi, 2/442. [2] See the references of hadith previously mentioned in the mosque entrance supplication, and for the additional part “O Allah, protect me from Satan, the accursed” see, Ibn Majah 1/129.

content_list.title: Thana - Praise of Allah
content_list.subtitle: Reciting Thana is Sunnah. The Prophet (SAW) used to recite Thana after Takbeer-e-Tahrima.
content_list.content:
Narrated by Aisha (RA), she said, whenever the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) commenced the prayer, he would say,

سُبْحَانَكَ اللّٰهُمَّ وَبِحَمْدِكَ وَتَبَارَكَ اسْمُكَ وَتَعَالٰى جَدُّكَ وَلَا إِلٰهَ غَيْرُكَ

Meaning: Glory is to You, O Allah, and praises are Yours, and blessed is Your Name, and exalted is Your Majesty, and there is no god but You.

Source: Muslim-399, Abu Dawood-775, Tirmidhi-243, Ibn Majah-806, Nasai-89

content_list.title: Dua for Bowing
content_list.subtitle: There are many supplications for bowing
content_list.content:
Dua 1
-------------------

سُبْحَانَ رَبِّيَ الْعَظِيْمِ

Glory is to my Lord, the Most Great.

Sources: Abu Dawood, no. 870; Tirmidhi, no. 262; Nasai, no. 1007; Ibn Majah, no. 897; Ahmad, no. 3514.

Dua 2
-------------------

سُبْحَانَكَ اللّٰهُمَّ رَبَّنَا وَبِحَمْدِكَ، اللّٰهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِيْ

O Allah, our Lord, all praise is to You. O Allah, forgive me.

Sources: Bukhari 1/99, no. 794; Muslim 1/350, no. 484

Dua 3
-------------------

سُبُّوْحٌ، قُدُّوْسٌ، رَبُّ الْمَلَائِكَةِ وَالرُّوْحِ

(He is) Holy and Pure, Lord of the angels and the spirit.

Sources: Muslim 1/353, no. 474; Abu Dawood 1/230, no. 872

Dua 4
-------------------

سُبْحَانَ ذِيْ الْجَبَرُوْتِ، وَالْمَلَكُوْتِ، وَالْكِبْرِيَاءِ، وَالْعَظَمَةِ

Glory is to the One Who has full power, sovereignty, magnificence, and majesty.

Sources: Abu Dawood 1/230 no. 873; Nasai-1131; Ahmad-13980

content_list.title: Dua when Rising from Ruku
content_list.subtitle: Standing straight after rising from Ruku is obligatory
content_list.content:
Dua 1
---------------

سَمِعَ اللّٰهُ لِمَنْ حَمِدَهُ

Allah has heard the one who praised Him.

Sources: Bukhari, no. 796

Dua 2
---------------

After reciting the first dua, say the following:

رَبَّنَا وَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ

O our Lord, and to You is all praise.

In voluntary prayer, we can extend this by saying:

رَبَّنَا وَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ، حَمْداً كَثِيْراً طَيِّباً مُبارَكاً فِيْهِ

O our Lord, and to You is all praise; a lot of good and blessed praise.

Sources: Bukhari, no. 796

content_list.title: Dua in Sujood
content_list.subtitle: The servant is closest to Allah during Sujood
content_list.content:
Dua 1
-------------------

سُبْحَانَ رَبِّيَ الأَعْلٰى

Glory to my Lord, the Most High.

Sources: Abu Dawood, Hadith no. 870; Tirmidhi, Hadith no. 262; Nasai, Hadith no. 1007; Ibn Majah, Hadith no. 897; Ahmad, Hadith no. 3514

Dua 2
-------------------

سُبْحَانَكَ اللّٰهُمَّ رَبَّنَا وَبِحَمْدِكَ، اللّٰهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِيْ

O Allah, our Lord, glory and praise be to You. O Allah, forgive me.

Sources: Bukhari, no. 794; Muslim, no. 484

Dua 3
-------------------

سُبُّوْحٌ، قُدُّوْسٌ، رَبُّ الْمَلَائِكَةِ وَالرُّوْحِ

(He/You) are without defect, Most Holy, Lord of the angels and the spirit.

Sources: Muslim 1/353, no. 487; Abu Dawood, no. 872

Dua 4
-------------------

اللّٰهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِيْ ذَنْبِيْ كُلَّهُ، دِقَّهُ وَجِلَّهُ، وَأَوَّلَهُ وَآخِرَهُ، وَعَلاَنِيَّتَهُ وَسِرَّهُ

O Allah, forgive me all my sins, the small and great, the first and last, the public and private.

Sources: Muslim 1/350, no. 483

content_list.title: Dua Between Two Sujoods
content_list.subtitle: Sitting straight and still between two Sujoods is obligatory
content_list.content:
Dua 1
-------------------

رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي، رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِيْ 

O my Lord, forgive me. O my Lord, forgive me.

Sources: Abu Dawood 1/231, no. 874; Ibn Majah, no. 897

Dua 2
-------------------

اللّٰهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي، وَارْحَمْنِي، وَاهْدِنِي، وَاجْبُرْنِي, وَعَافِنِي, وَارْزُقْنِي, وَارْفَعْنِيْ 

O Allah, forgive me, have mercy on me, guide me, cover my shortcomings, grant me health, provide for me, and elevate me.

Sources: Abu Dawood, 1/231, no. 850; Tirmidhi, no. 284, 285; Ibn Majah, no. 898

content_list.title: Tashahhud - Attahiyat
content_list.subtitle: It is obligatory to recite Tashahhud in the second and last sitting of prayer
content_list.content:
اَلتَّحِيَّاتُ لِلّٰهِ، وَالصَّلَوَاتُ، وَالطَّيِّبَاتُ، اَلسَّلاَمُ عَلَيْكَ أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ وَرَحْمَةُ اللّٰهِ وَبَرَكَاتُهُ، اَلسَّلاَمُ عَلَيْنَا وَعَلٰى عِبَادِ اللّٰهِ الصَّالِحِيْنَ، أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لَّا إِلٰهَ إِلَّا اللّٰهُ وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُهٗ وَرَسُوْلُهٗ

All compliments are for Allah, and all prayers and good words. Peace be upon you, O Prophet, and the mercy of Allah and His blessings. Peace be upon us and on the righteous servants of Allah. I bear witness that there is no god but Allah and I bear witness that Muhammad is His slave and Messenger.

Sources: Bukhari, no. 831; Muslim 1/301, no. 402

content_list.title: Darood Sharif
content_list.subtitle: The best among Daroods is Darood-e-Ibrahim
content_list.content:
Darood Sharif (Darood-e-Ibrahim)
------------------------------------------

اللّٰهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ، وَعَلَى آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ، كَمَا صَلَّيْتَ عَلَى إِبْرَاهِيْمَ، وَعَلَى آلِ إِبْرَاهِيْمَ، إِنَّكَ حَمِيْدٌ مَجِيْدٌ،

اللّٰهُمَّ بَارِكْ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَّعَلَى آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ، كَمَا بَارَكْتَ عَلَى إِبْرَاهِيْمَ وَعَلَى آلِ إِبْرَاهِيْمَ، إِنَّكَ حَمِيْدٌ مَجِيْدٌ

Meaning: O Allah, send blessings upon Muhammad and upon the family of Muhammad, as You sent blessings upon Ibrahim and upon the family of Ibrahim. Indeed, You are Praiseworthy and Glorious. O Allah, bless Muhammad and the family of Muhammad as You blessed Ibrahim and the family of Ibrahim. Indeed, You are Praiseworthy and Glorious.

Sources: Bukhari, no. 3370; Muslim, no. 406

content_list.title: Dua before Ending Prayer (Dua Masura)
content_list.subtitle: One or more of the following supplications can be recited after Darood Sharif and before Salam
content_list.content:
Dua 1
-------------------

اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِيْ ظُلْمْاً كَثِيْراً، وَلاَ يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوْبَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ، فَاغْفِرْ لِيْ مَغْفِرَةً مِّنْ عِنْدِكَ وَارْحَمْنِي، إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الغَفُوْرُ الرَّحِيْمُ

O Allah, I have greatly wronged myself, and none forgives sins but You. So grant me forgiveness and have mercy on me. You are the Forgiving, the Merciful.

Sources: Bukhari, no. 834; Muslim 4/2078, no. 2705

Dua 2
-------------------

اللّٰهُمَّ أَعِنِّيْ عَلَى ذِكْرِكَ، وَشُكْرِكَ, وَحُسْنِ عِبَادَتِكَ

O Allah, help me to remember You, give thanks to You, and worship You in an excellent manner.

Sources: Abu Dawood, no. 1522; Nasai, no. 2302

Dua 3
-------------------

اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَسْأَلُكَ بِأَنَّ لَكَ الْحَمْدَ لَا إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ وَحْدَكَ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَكَ، الْمَنَّانُ، يَا بَدِيْعَ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ يَا ذَا الْجَلاَلِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ، يَا حَيُّ يَا قَيُّوْمُ إِنِّيْ أَسْأَلُكَ الْجَنَّةَ وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ النَّارِ

O Allah, I ask You, as all praise is Yours, none has the right to be worshipped but You alone, without partner. You are the Benefactor, originator of the heavens and the earth, the Possessor of glory and honor. O Ever-Living, O Self-Existing One, I ask You for Paradise and seek Your protection from the Fire.

Sources: Abu Dawood, no. 1495; Tirmidhi, no. 3544; Ibn Majah, no. 3858; Nasai, no. 1299

content_list.title: Dua/Zikr After Salam
content_list.subtitle: The following supplication and remembrance are Sunnah after saying Salam
content_list.content:
Say once:

اللّٰهُ أَكْبَر‎

(Allah is the greatest!)

*** *** ***

Say three times:

أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللّٰهَ

I ask Allah for forgiveness.

Afterwards say:

اللّٰهُمَّ أَنْتَ السَّلاَمُ، وَمِنْكَ السَّلاَمُ، تَبَارَكْتَ يَا ذَا الْجَلاَلِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ

O Allah, You are Peace, and from You is peace. Blessed are You, O Possessor of majesty and honour.

Sources: Muslim, no. 591

*** *** ***

Then say once,

لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللّٰهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ,

No one has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner; to Him belongs dominion and praise, and He is able to do all things.

Then say,

اللّٰهُمَّ لاَ مَانِعَ لِمَا أَعْطَيْتَ، وَلاَ مُعْطِيَ لِمَا مَنَعْتَ، وَلاَ يَنْفَعُ ذَا الْجَدِّ مِنْكَ الجَدُّ

O Allah, none withhold what You grant, and none can grant what You withhold, and the fortune of the fortunate does not avail him against You.

Sources: Bukhari, no. 844; Muslim, no. 593

*** *** ***

Say each of Subhan Allah, Alhamdulillah, and Allahu Akbar 33 times,

سُبْحَانَ اللّٰهِ Allah is free from imperfection.
وَالْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ All praise be to Allah.
وَاللّٰهُ أَكْبَرُ Allah is the greatest.

Then say,

لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللّٰهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ

There is no deity worthy of worship except Allah alone. He has no partners. To Him belongs the dominion and praise, and He is over all things, powerful.

Sources: Muslim, 1/418, no. 597;

*** *** ***

After Maghrib and Fajr prayers, say 10 times,

لَا إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللّٰهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ يُحْيِيْ وَيُمِيْتُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ

There is no deity worthy of worship except Allah alone, Who has no partner; to Him belongs dominion and praise, and He gives life and causes death; and He is able to do all things.

Sources: Tirmidhi, no. 3474; Ahmad, no. 17990. For hadith attribution, see also Zadul Ma'ad 1/300.

*** *** ***

After Fajr prayer, say,

اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَسْأَلُكَ عِلْمًا نَافِعًا، وَرِزْقًا طَيِّبًا، وَعَمَلًا مُتَقَبَّلًا

O Allah, I ask You for beneficial knowledge, good provision, and deeds that are accepted.

Sources: Ibn Majah, no. 925; Nasai, in His Amalul Yawm wa Lailah, hadith no. 102
*** *** ***

After every obligatory prayer, it is Sunnah to recite Surah Ikhlas, Surah Falaq, and Surah Nas once.

Sources: Abu Dawood, no. 1523; Tirmidhi, no. 2903; Nasai, no. 1335

*** *** ***

After every prayer, reciting Ayat-ul-Kursi (The Throne Verse) once. Whoever recites Ayat-ul-Kursi after each prayer, there is nothing between him and entering Paradise except death.

اللّٰهُ لَآ إِلٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْحَىُّ الْقَيُّوْمُ ۚ
Allah, there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence.

لَا تَأْخُذُهُ سِنَةٌ وَّلَا نَوْمٌ ۚ
Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep.

لَّهُ مَا فِى السَّمٰوٰتِ وَمَا فِى الْأَرْضِ ۗ
To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth.

مَنْ ذَا الَّذِى يَشْفَعُ عِنْدَهُ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهٖ ۚ
Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission?

يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيْهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ ۖ
He knows what is before them and what will be after them.

وَلَا يُحِيْطُوْنَ بِشَىْءٍ مِّنْ عِلْمِهٖٓ إِلَّا بِمَا شَآءَ ۚ
And they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills.

وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ السَّمٰوٰتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۖ
His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth,

وَلاَ يَؤُوْدُهُ حِفْظُهُمَا ۚ
and their preservation tires Him not.

وَهُوَ الْعَلِىُّ الْعَظِيْمُ
And He is the Most High, the Most Great.

Sources: Nasai, Amalul Yawm Wal Laylah, no. 100; Ibnus Sunni, no. 121
The Throne Verse is the 255th verse of Surah Al-Baqarah.

content_list.title: Dua Qunoot
content_list.subtitle: Any of the following Qunoot can be recited in Witr Prayers
content_list.content:
Dua Qunoot 1
------------------------

اَللّٰهُمَّ اِنَّا نَسْتَعِيْنُكَ وَنَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وَنُؤْمِنُ بِكَ وَنَتَوَكَّلُ عَلَيْكَ وَنُثْنِىْ عَلَيْكَ الْخَيْرَ وَنَشْكُرُكَ وَلَا نَكْفُرُكَ وَنَخْلَعُ وَنَتْرُكُ مَنْ يَّفْجُرُكَ-اَللّٰهُمَّ اِيَّاكَ نَعْبُدُ وَلَكَ نُصَلِّىْ وَنَسْجُدُ وَاِلَيْكَ نَسْعٰى وَنَحْفِدُ وَنَرْجُوْ رَحْمَتَكَ وَنَخْشٰى عَذَابَكَ اِنَّ عَذَابَكَ بِالْكُفَّارِ مُلْحِقٌ

O Allah, we seek Your help and forgiveness, and we believe in You and rely on You, and we praise You with all good, and we thank You and do not deny You, and we abandon and turn away from whoever disobeys You. O Allah, we worship You and pray for You and prostrate to You, and we strive towards You and serve You. We hope for Your mercy and fear Your punishment. Indeed, Your punishment is due on the disbelievers.

Dua Qunoot 2
------------------------

اللّٰهُمَّ اهْدِنِيْ فِيْمَنْ هَدَيْتَ، وَعَافِنِيْ فِيْمَنْ عَافَيْتَ، وَتَوَلَّنِيْ فِيْمَنْ تَوَلَّيْتَ، وَبَارِكْ لِيْ فِيْمَا أَعْطَيْتَ، وَقِنِيْ شَرَّ مَا قَضَيْتَ

O Allah, guide me among those You have guided, and grant me security among those You have granted security. Take me into Your protective care among those You have taken into Your protective care. Bless me in what You have given, and save me from the evil of what You decreed.

فَإِنَّكَ تَقْضِيْ وَلاَ يُقْضَى عَلَيْكَ، إِنَّهُ لاَ يَذِلُّ مَنْ وَّالَيْتَ، (وَلاَ يَعِزُّ مَنْ عَادَيْتَ) تَبارَكْتَ رَبَّنْا وَتَعَالَيْتَ

You alone decree and none can decree over You. Indeed, he whom You befriend cannot be humiliated, and he whom You show enmity to is not honored. Blessed are You, O Lord, and Exalted.

Sources: Abu Dawood, no. 1425; Tirmidhi, no. 464; Nasai, no. 1744; Ibn Majah, no. 1178; Ahmad, no. 1718; Darimi, no. 1592; Hakim, 3/172; Baihaqi, 2/209. The part in brackets is from Baihaqi.

Dua Qunoot 3
------------------------

اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَعُوْذُ بِرِضَاكَ مِنْ سَخَطِكَ، وَبِمُعَافَاتِكَ مِنْ عُقُوْبَتِكَ، وَأَعُــوْذُ بِكَ مِنْكَ، لاَ أُحْصِيْ ثَنَاءً عَلَيْكَ، أَنْتَ كَمَا أَثْنَيْتَ عَلَى نَفْسِكَ

O Allah, I seek refuge in Your pleasure from Your anger, and in Your forgiveness from Your punishment. I seek refuge in You from You. I cannot praise You enough; You are as You have praised Yourself.

Sources: Abu Dawood, no. 1427; Tirmidhi, no. 3566; Nasai, no. 1746; Ibn Majah, no. 1179; Ahmad, no. 751

content_list.title: Dua Between Four Rakaats of Taraweeh
content_list.content:
There is no specific Dua mentioned in Hadith for reciting during the break after every four rakaats of Taraweeh. Any Dua can be recited at this time. This time is mainly for rest. Taraweeh itself means rest.

In our society, there is a Dua commonly recited at this time. The Dua is not mentioned in any Hadith. Therefore, instead of struggling with wrong pronunciation to recite this Dua, recite Subhanallah Alhamdulillah or any similar Dua with correct pronunciation. Even taking rest is permissible. It is well said that reciting less with correct pronunciation is better than reciting more with incorrect pronunciation, especially if that specific Dua is not mentioned in Hadith for that occasion.

content_list.title: The Procedure and Dua of Janazah Prayer
content_list.subtitle: There is no Ruku, Sujud or recital in Janazah prayer
content_list.content:
It is Sunnah to supplicate for the deceased after the third Takbir in the Janazah prayer. One of the prayers narrated in Hadith is as follows:

For all adult men and women, recite the following:

اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِحَيِّنَا وَمَيِّتِنَا، وَشَاهِدِنَا وَغَائِبِنَا، وَصَغِيرِنَا وَكَبِيرِنَا, وَذَكَرِنَا وَأُنْثَانَا، اللَّهُمَّ مَنْ أَحْيَيْتَهُ مِنَّا فَأَحْيِهِ عَلَى الْإِسْلاَمِ, وَمَنْ تَوَفَّيْتَهُ مِنَّا فَتَوَفَّهُ عَلَى الإِيمَانِ, اللَّهُمَّ لاَ تَحْرِمْنَا أَجْرَهُ، وَلاَ تُضِلَّنَا بَعْدَهُ

Translation: O Allah! Forgive us our living and our dead, those present and those absent, our young and our old, and our males and females. O Allah! Whomever You keep alive among us, keep him alive upon Islam, and whomever You cause to die, let him die upon faith. O Allah! Do not withhold from us the reward of his and do not let us go astray after him.

(Abu Dawood 3201)

For minors, recite the following:

اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْهُ لَنَا فَرَطاً، وَسَلَفاً، وَأَجْراً

Translation: O Allah! Make him for us a leader, a predecessor, and a reward.

(This Dua is narrated in Sahih Bukhari 1335 without mentioning any sanad before mentioning this Dua.)

If you don't have the above Duas memorized, then in prayer for everyone, both male and female, young and old, recite the following:

اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتِ

Translation: O Allah! Forgive the believing men and women.

content_list.title: Dua before sleeping
content_list.subtitle: Let's make sleep an act of worship
content_list.content:
Dua
------------------

بِاسْمِكَ اللّٰهُمَّ أَمُوْتُ وَأَحْيَا

অথবা,

اللَّهُمَّ بِاسْـمِكَ أَمُوتُ وَأَحْيَا

O Allah! In Your name I die (sleep) and in Your name I live (wake up).

Bukhari, No. 6324; Muslim 4/2083, No. 2711

content_list.title: Practices and Duas before sleeping and at night
content_list.subtitle: Let's make sleep an act of worship
content_list.content:
Before sleeping, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) used to perform several acts. By observing these Sunnahs, we can make our sleep equivalent to worship. The Sunnahs before sleeping and some night practices are listed below.

1. Covering utensils, pots, and extinguishing lights
2. Performing ablution (Wudu)
3. Reciting specific duas before sleeping (e.g., Allahumma Bismika Amutu wa Ahya)
4. Reciting Surah Al-Kafirun, Surah Al-Ikhlas, Surah Al-Falaq, and Surah An-Nas
5. Reciting Subhanallah 33 times, Alhamdulillah 33 times, and Allahu Akbar 34 times
6. Reciting Ayatul Kursi
7. Reciting the last two verses of Surah Al-Baqarah
8. Reciting Surah As-Sajdah and Surah Al-Mulk
9. Sleeping on the right side

Duas to be recited before sleeping
===============================

Dua 1
---------------------

بِاسْمِكَ اللّٰهُمَّ أَمُوْتُ وَأَحْيَا

অথবা,

اللّٰهُمَّ بِاسْـمِكَ أَمُوتُ وَأَحْيَا

O Allah! In Your name I die (sleep) and in Your name I live (wake up).

[Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 6324, 6325]

Dua 2
----------------------

When the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) intended to sleep, he would place his right hand under his cheek and then say this dua:

اللّٰهُمَّ قِنِيْ عَذَابَكَ يَوْمَ تَبْعَثُ عِبَادَكَ

Meaning: O Allah! Protect me from Your punishment on the Day You resurrect Your servants.

[Sunan Abu Dawud, No. 5045]

Dua 3
---------------------

اللّٰهُمَّ خَلَقْتَ نَفْسِى وَأَنْتَ تَوَفَّاهَا لَكَ مَمَاتُهَا وَمَحْيَاهَا إِنْ أَحْيَيْتَهَا فَاحْفَظْهَا وَإِنْ أَمَتَّهَا فَاغْفِرْ لَهَا اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّى أَسْأَلُكَ الْعَافِيَةَ

Meaning: O Allah! You created my soul and You will cause it to die. Its death and its life are in Your possession. If You keep it alive, then protect it, and if You cause it to die, then forgive it. O Allah! I ask You for well-being.

[Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2712]

Dua 4
---------------------

اللّٰهُمَّ رَبَّ السَّمَوَاتِ وَ... [truncated]

content_list.title: Dua to recite after waking up from sleep
content_list.subtitle: Let our day begin with praise and gratitude to Allah
content_list.content:
Dua 1
-------------------

اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ الَّذِيْ أَحْيَانَا بَعْدَ مَا أَمَاتَنَا، وَإِلَيْهِ النُّشُوْرُ

All praise is due to Allah, who revived us after our death (sleep), and to Him is the resurrection.

Bukhari, No. 6314; Muslim, No. 2711

Dua 2
-------------------

لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللّٰهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ، سُبْحَانَ اللّٰهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ، وَلاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللّٰهُ، وَاللّٰهُ أَكْبَرُ، وَلاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللّٰهِ الْعَلِيِّ الْعَظِيْمِ، رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِيْ

There is no god worthy of worship except Allah, alone, without partner. To Him belongs sovereignty and to Him belongs praise, and He is over all things competent. Glory be to Allah, and praise be to Allah, and there is no god worthy of worship except Allah, and Allah is the greatest. There is no might or power except with Allah, the Most High, the Most Great. My Lord! Forgive me.
Bukhari, No. 1154.

Dua 3
-------------------

اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ الَّذِيْ عَافَانِيْ فِيْ جَسَدِي، وَرَدَّ عَلَيَّ رُوْحِي، وَأَذِنَ لِيْ بِذِكْرِهِ

All praise is due to Allah, who has given health to my body, returned my soul to me, and allowed me to remember Him.

Tirmidhi, No. 3401.

content_list.title: Dua for entering the toilet
content_list.subtitle: Reciting dua before entering the toilet keeps one safe from evil jinn and devils
content_list.content:
بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ

In the name of Allah

اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْখُব্থِ وَالْখَبَائِثِ

O Allah! I seek refuge in You from the male and female evil spirits.

Bukhari, No. 142; Muslim, No. 375, Tirmidhi, No. 606.

content_list.title: Dua to recite after leaving the toilet
content_list.subtitle: We can recite any of the duas below or both
content_list.content:
Dua 1
-------------------
غُفْرَانَكَ

I seek Your forgiveness.

This Hadith has been narrated by all compilers of Sunan except Nasa'i; however, Nasa'i narrated it in his 'Amalul Yawmi wal-Laylah' (No. 79). Abu Dawud, No. 30; Tirmidhi, No. 7; Ibn Majah, No. 300.

Dua 2
-------------------

الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي أَذْهَبَ عَنِّي الْأَذَى وَعَافَانِي

All praise is due to Allah, who has removed from me the harm and given me well-being.

Ibn Majah, Hadith 303. This Hadith is weak. There is no harm in acting upon such Hadith in the case of Dua.

content_list.title: Dua for wearing clothes
content_list.subtitle: By following the Sunnah, we can turn every action of our lives into worship
content_list.content:
اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ الَّذِيْ كَسَانِيْ هَذَا الثَّوْبَ وَرَزَقَنِيْهِ مِنْ غَيْرِ حَوْلٍ مِنِّيْ وَلاَ قُوَّةٍ

All praise is due to Allah; who has clothed me with this (garment) and provided it to me without any strength or power from me.

Abu Dawud, No. 4023.

content_list.title: Dua for wearing new clothes
content_list.subtitle: New clothes are a blessing from Allah, and expressing gratitude for blessings is an act of worship
content_list.content:
اللّٰهُمَّ لَكَ الْحَمْدُ أَنْتَ كَسَوْتَنِيْهِ، أَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ خَيْرِهِ وَخَيْرِ مَا صُنِعَ لَهُ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهِ وَشَرِّ مَا صُنِعَ لَهُ

O Allah! All praise is due to You. You have clothed me with this. I ask You for its good and the good for which it was made. And I seek refuge in You from its evil and the evil for which it was made.

Abu Dawud, No. 4020; Tirmidhi, No. 1767.

content_list.title: Dua for someone wearing new clothes
content_list.subtitle: Wishing well for another Muslim brother is an act of worship
content_list.content:
Dua 1
-------------------

تُبْلِيْ وَيُخْلِفُ اللّٰهُ تَعَالَى

You will wear it out, and Allah the Almighty will replace it.

Sunan Abi Dawud, No. 4020.

Dua 2
-------------------

اِلْبَسْ جَدِيْداً وَّعِشْ حَمِيْداً وَّمُتْ شَهِيْداً

Wear new clothes, live a praiseworthy life, and die as a martyr.

Sunan Ibn Majah, No. 3558.

content_list.title: Dua for starting a meal
content_list.subtitle: It is Sunnah to wash both hands well before eating
content_list.content:
Dua 1
-------------------

(At the beginning)
بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ

In the name of Allah (I begin eating)

And if one forgets to say Bismillah at the beginning,

بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ أَوَّلَهُ وَآخِرَهُ

In the name of Allah, at its beginning and its end (of eating)

Abu Dawud 3/347, No. 3767.

content_list.title: Dua after finishing a meal
content_list.subtitle: It is Sunnah to wash both hands well after eating
content_list.content:
Dua 1
......................

اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ الَّذِيْ اَطْعَمَنَا وَسَقَانَا وَجَعَلَنَا مُسْلِمِيْنَ

Meaning: All praise is due to Allah, who has fed us, given us drink, and made us Muslims. [Sunan Abu Dawud, Hadith 3852]

Dua 2
......................

اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ الَّذِيْ اَطْعَمَ وَسَقٰى وَسَوَّغَهٗ وَجَعَلَ لَهٗ مَخْرَجًا

Meaning: All praise is due to Allah, who has fed, given drink, made it easy to swallow, and provided an exit for it. [Sunan Abu Dawud, Hadith 3853]

Dua 3
......................

اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ الَّذِىْ اَطْعَمَنِـيْ هٰذَا الطَّعَامَ وَرَزَقَنِيْهِ مِنْ غَيْرِ حَوْلٍ مِنِّـيْ وَلَا قُوَّةٍ

Meaning: All praise is due to Allah, who has fed me this food and provided it to me without any strength or power from me.

Virtue: It is mentioned in Hadith that whoever recites this dua after eating, his past and future sins will be forgiven. [Sunan Abu Dawud, Hadith 4025]

Dua 4
......................

اللّٰهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَنَا فِيْهِ وَأَطْعِمْنَا خَيْراً مِنْهُ

O Allah! Bless us in this food and feed us better than it. [Tirmidhi, Hadith 3455]

Dua after drinking milk

اللّٰهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَنَا فِيْهِ وَزِدْنَا مِنْهُ

O Allah! Bless us in it (this milk) and give us more of it.

[Tirmidhi, Hadith 3455]

content_list.title: Dua when leaving home
content_list.subtitle: Dua seeking refuge from danger and the whispers of Shaytan
content_list.content:
Dua 1
-------------------

بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ، تَوَكَّلْتُ عَلَى اللّٰهِ، لَا حَوْلَ وَلَا قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللّٰهِ

In the name of Allah (I am leaving). I have put my trust in Allah. There is no might or power except with Allah.

[Abu Dawud, Hadith 5095; Tirmidhi, Hadith 3426]

Dua 2
-------------------

اللّٰـهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ أَنْ أَضِلَّ، أَوْ أُضَلَّ، أَوْ أَزِلَّ، أَوْ أُZALَّ، أَوْ أَظْلِمَ، أَوْ أُظْلَمَ، أَوْ أَجْهَلَ، أَوْ يُجْهَلَ عَلَيَّ

O Allah! I seek refuge in You lest I stray or be led astray, lest I slip or be made to slip, lest I oppress or be oppressed, lest I act ignorantly or ignorance be done to me.

[Abu Dawud, Hadith 5094; Tirmidhi, Hadith 3427; Nasa'i, Hadith 5501; Ibn Majah, Hadith 3884]

content_list.title: Dua when entering home
content_list.subtitle: It is Sunnah to greet the household members upon entering home
content_list.content:
بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ وَلَجْنَا، وَبِسْمِ اللّٰهِ خَرَجْنَا، وَعَلَى اللّٰهِ رَبِّنَا تَوَكَّلْنَا

In the name of Allah we enter, and in the name of Allah we exit, and upon Allah, our Lord, we rely.

After reciting this dua, one should greet the household members with Salam. [Abu Dawud, Hadith 5096]

In another Hadith, it is mentioned that when one of you enters his house and remembers Allah upon entering and upon eating, Shaytan (to his disciples) says, 'You have no lodging, and you have no supper.' [Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2018]

content_list.title: Dua to recite when the wind blows
content_list.subtitle: Seeking refuge from the harm of the wind
content_list.content:
اللّٰهُمَّ اِنِّـيْ اَسْاَلُكَ خَيْرَهَا وَخَيْرَ مَا فِيْهَا وَخَيْرَ مَا اُرْسِلَتْ بِهِ ، وَاَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهَا وَشَرِّ مَا فِيْهَا وَشَرِّ مَا اُرْسِلَتْ بِهِ

Meaning: O Allah! I ask You for the good of this wind, the good of what is in it, and the good with which it has been sent. And I seek refuge in You from its evil, the evil of what is in it, and the evil with which it has been sent. [Sahih Muslim, Hadith 899]

اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَهَا، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهَا

O Allah! I ask You for its good. And I seek refuge in You from its evil. [Abu Dawud, Hadith 5099; Ibn Majah, Hadith 3727]

content_list.title: Dua to recite upon hearing thunder
content_list.content:
اَللّٰهُمَّ لَا تَقْتُلْنَا بِغَضَبِكَ وَلَا تُهْلِكْنَا بِعَذَابِكَ وَعَافِنَا قَبْلَ ذٰلِكَ

Meaning: O Allah! Do not kill us with Your wrath, and do not destroy us with Your punishment. Rather, grant us safety and deliverance before that.

[Jami' Tirmidhi, Hadith 3450]

content_list.title: Dua when it rains
content_list.subtitle: Praying for beneficial rain
content_list.content:
اللّٰهُمَّ صَيِّباً نَافِعاً

O Allah! Make this rain beneficial for us. [Musnad Ahmad, Hadith 24144]

content_list.title: Dua for riding a vehicle
content_list.subtitle: May Allah protect us from road accidents
content_list.content:
بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ ، سُبْحَانَ الَّذِيْ سَخَّرَ لَنَا هَذَا وَمَا كُنَّا لَهُ مُقْرِنِيْنَ، وَإِنَّا إِلَى رَبِّنَا لَمُنْقَلِبُوْنَ ، الْHAMDULILLAH، الْHAMDULILLAH، الْHAMDULILLAH، ALLAHU AKBAR، ALLAHU AKBAR، ALLAHU AKBAR، SUBHANAKALLAHUMMA INNI ZALAMTU NAFSI FAGHFIR LI، FAINNAHU LA YAGHFIRUZ ZUNUBA ILLA ANTA

In the name of Allah I begin the journey; and all praise is due to Allah. Glorified be He who has subjected this to us, and we were not capable of it. And indeed, to our Lord we will return. All praise is due to Allah, all praise is due to Allah, all praise is due to Allah. Allah is the greatest, Allah is the greatest, Allah is the greatest. Glorified be You, O Allah! Indeed, I have wronged myself, so forgive me. For none forgives sins except You.

[Abu Dawud, Hadith 2602; Tirmidhi, Hadith 3446]

content_list.title: Dua for entering the market
content_list.subtitle: The market is the most disliked place by Allah
content_list.content:
The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: Whoever enters the market and recites this dua, Allah will write for him one million good deeds, forgive him one million sins, and raise his status by one million degrees.

لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللّٰهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ، وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، يُحْيِيْ وَيُمِيْتُ، وَهُوَ حَيٌّ لاَ يَمُوْتُ، بِيَدِهِ الْخَيْرُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ

There is no god worthy of worship except Allah, alone, without partner. To Him belongs sovereignty, and to Him belongs praise. He gives life and causes death, and He is the Ever-Living who does not die. In His hand is all good, and He is over all things competent. [Tirmidhi, No. 3428; Ibn Majah, No. 3860]

content_list.title: Dua for entering a new village or city
content_list.content:
اَللّٰهُمَّ رَبَّ السَّمَاوَاتِ السَّبْعِ وَمَا اَظْلَلْنَ ، وَرَبَّ الْاَرَضِيْنَ السَّبْعِ وَمَا اَقْلَلْنَ ، وَرَبَّ الرِّيَاحِ وَمَا ذَرَيْنَ ، وَرَبَّ الشَّيَاطِيْنِ وَمَا اَضْلَلْنَ نَسْاَلُكَ خَيْرَ هٰذِهِ الْقَرْيَةِ وَخَيْرَ اَهْلِهَا ، وَنَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهَا وَشَرِّ اَهْلِهَا وَشَرِّ مَا فِيْهَا.

Meaning: O Allah! Lord of the seven heavens and what they overshadow, and Lord of the seven earths and what they carry, and Lord of the winds and what they scatter, and Lord of the devils and whom they mislead. We ask You for the good of this village and the good of its people. And we seek refuge in You from its evil, and the evil of its people, and the evil of what is in it. [Sahih Ibn Hibban, Hadith 2709]

content_list.title: Dua when someone repays a loan
content_list.subtitle: The repayment for a lender is to repay the loan on time and express gratitude to him
content_list.content:
بارَكَ اللّٰهُ لَكَ فِيْ أَهْلِكَ وَمَالِكَ

May Allah bless you in your family and your wealth.
[Sunan Nasa'i, Hadith 4683]

content_list.title: Dua for someone who treats you well
content_list.content:
جَزَاكَ اللّٰهُ خَيْراً

May Allah reward you with good.

[Tirmidhi, Hadith No. 2035]

content_list.title: What a Muslim should say when praised in front of him
content_list.content:
اللّٰهُمَّ لاَ تُؤَاخِذْنِيْ بِمَا يَقُوْلُوْنَ، وَاغْفِرْ لِيْ مَا لاَ يَعْلَمُوْنَ، (وَاجْعَلْنِيْ خَيْراً مِمَّا يَظُّنُّوْنَ)

O Allah, do not hold me accountable for what they say, and forgive me for what they do not know (about me), and make me better than what they think of me. [Shu'abul Iman, Hadith 4534]

content_list.title: Dua when hearing the crow of a rooster, the bray of a donkey, or the barking of dogs at night
content_list.content:
The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: When you hear the crow of a rooster, then ask Allah for His bounty, for it has seen an angel. And when you hear the bray of a donkey, then seek refuge with Allah from Shaytan; for it has seen Shaytan. [Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 3303]

In another Hadith, it is mentioned that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: When you hear the barking of dogs and the braying of donkeys at night, then seek refuge with Allah from them; for they see what you do not see. [Abu Dawud, Hadith 5105]

Dua for seeking refuge with Allah:

أَعُوْذُ بِاللّٰهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيْـمِ

I seek refuge with Allah from the accursed Shaytan.

content_list.title: Dua after sneezing and its reply
content_list.content:
The one who sneezes should say:

اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ

All praise is due to Allah

And the one who hears this dua should say:

يَرْحَمُكَ اللّٰهُ

May Allah have mercy on you.

Then the one who sneezed should say:

يَهْدِيْكُمُ اللّٰهُ وَيُصْلِحُ بَالَكُمْ

May Allah guide you and rectify your affairs. [Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5870]

content_list.title: Dua before intercourse with wife
content_list.subtitle: Dua for righteous offspring and seeking refuge from Shaytan
content_list.content:
بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ، اللّٰهُمَّ جَنِّبْنَا الشَّيْطَانَ، وَجَنِّبِ الشَّيْطَانَ مَا رَزَقْتَنَا

In the name of Allah. O Allah! Keep Shaytan away from us, and keep Shaytan away from what You have provided us (i.e., offspring).
[Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 141]

content_list.title: Dua for the one who says, 'I love you for the sake of Allah'
content_list.content:
أَحَبَّكَ الَّذِيْ أَحْبَبْتَنِيْ لَهُ

May the One for whom you loved me, love you.

[Abu Dawud, Hadith 5125]

content_list.title: Dua for Iftar
content_list.subtitle: The dua of a fasting person before Iftar is not rejected
content_list.content:
Before Iftar
-------------------

اللّٰهُمَّ لَكَ صُمْتُ وَعَلَى رِزْقِكَ أَفْطَرْتُ

O Allah! I have fasted for Your sake and I break my fast with Your provision. [Abu Dawud, Hadith 2360]

After Iftar
-------------------

ذَهَبَ الظَّمَأُ وَابْتَلَّتِ العُرُوْقُ، وَثَبَتَ الْأَجْرُ إِنْ شَاءَ اللّٰهُ

Thirst has gone, the veins are moistened, and the reward is confirmed, if Allah wills.

[Abu Dawud, No. 2359]

content_list.title: Dua for the family when breaking fast as a guest
content_list.subtitle: One who provides Iftar to a fasting person receives the same reward as them
content_list.content:
أَفْطَرَ عِنْدَكُمُ الصَّائِمُوْنَ، وَأَكَلَ طَعَامَكُمُ الْأَبْرَارُ، وَصَلَّتْ عَلَيْكُمُ الْمَلاَئِكَةُ

May the fasting people break their fast with you, may the righteous eat your food, and may the angels pray for you.

Sunan Abi Dawud, No. 3856; Ibn Majah, No. 1747

content_list.title: Dua for Laylatul Qadr
content_list.content:
اللّٰهُمَّ إِنَّكَ عَفُوٌّ تُحِبُّ الْعَفْوَ فَاعْفُ عَنِّيْ

O Allah! You are the Forgiver, You love to forgive, so forgive me.

Sunan Ibn Majah, Hadith 3850

content_list.title: Ayatul Kursi - Protection from Jinn and Satan
content_list.subtitle: Ayatul Kursi is the greatest verse of the Quran
content_list.content:
Whoever recites Ayatul Kursi in the morning will be under Allah’s protection from jinn and Satan until the evening, and whoever recites it in the evening will be under Allah’s protection from jinn and Satan until the morning.

اَللّٰهُ لَآ إِلٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ اَلْحَىُّ الْقَيُّومُ ۚ لَا تَأْخُذُهٗ سِنَةٌ وَّلَا نَوْمٌ ۚ لَهٗ مَا فِى السَّمٰوٰتِ وَمَا فِى الْأَرْضِ ؕ مَنْ ذَا الَّذِى يَشْفَعُ عِندَهٗ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهٖ ؕ يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ ۖ وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِشَىْءٍ مِّنْ عِلْمِهٖۤ إِلَّا بِمَاشَآءَ ۚ وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ السَّمٰوٰتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۚ وَلَا يَـُٔوْدُهٗ حِفْظُهُمَا ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَلِىُّ الْعَظِيمُ

Allah! There is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence. Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is before them and what is behind them, and they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills. His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Most High, the Most Great.

(Surah Baqarah-255)

Hakim, Mustadrak, Hadith 2064

content_list.title: Surah Ikhlas, Falaq, and Nas for Protection from All Harm
content_list.subtitle: Surahs for protection from magic, evil eye, and jinn and Satan
content_list.content:
The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said, whoever recites Surah Ikhlas, Surah Falaq, and Surah Nas three times in the morning and evening, it will suffice him for protection from everything.

(Abu Dawood, No. 5082; Tirmidhi, No. 3575)

Surah Ikhlas
----------------------

قُلْ هُوَ اللّٰهُ أَحَدٌ ﴿١﴾ اللّٰهُ الصَّمَدُ ﴿٢﴾ لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُوْلَدْ ﴿٣﴾ وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَّهٗ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ ﴿٤﴾

Say, He is Allah, [who is] One. Allah, the Eternal Refuge. He neither begets nor is born. Nor is there to Him any equivalent.

Surah Falaq
----------------------

قُلْ أَعُوْذُ بِرَ‌بِّ الْفَلَقِ ﴿١﴾ مِنْ شَرِّ‌ مَا خَلَقَ ﴿٢﴾ وَمِنْ شَرِّ‌ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ ﴿٣﴾ وَمِنْ شَرِّ‌ النَّفّٰثٰتِ فِيْ الْعُقَدِ ﴿٤﴾ وَمِنْ شَرِّ‌ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ ﴿٥﴾

Say, I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak. From the evil of that which He created. And from the evil of darkness when it settles. And from the evil of the blowers in knots. And from the evil of an envier when he envies.

Surah Nas
----------------------

قُلْ أَعُوْذُ بِرَ‌بِّ النَّاسِ ﴿١﴾ مَلِكِ النَّاسِ ﴿٢﴾ إِلَـٰهِ النَّاسِ ﴿٣﴾ مِنْ شَرِّ‌ الْوَسْوَاسِ الْخَنَّاسِ ﴿٤﴾ الَّذِيْ يُوَسْوِسُ فِيْ صُدُوْرِ‌ النَّاسِ ﴿٥﴾ مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَالنَّاسِ ﴿٦﴾

Say, I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind, The Sovereign of mankind, The God of mankind, From the evil of the whisperer who withdraws, Who whispers in the breasts of mankind, From among the jinn and mankind.

content_list.title: Dua for Protection from All Harm
content_list.subtitle: By the blessings of this dua, inshallah, you will be protected from all kinds of harm
content_list.content:
Whoever recites this dua three times in the morning and three times in the evening, nothing will be able to harm him.

بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ الَّذِيْ لاَ يَضُرُّ مَعَ اسْمِهِ شَيْءٌ فِيْ الْأَرْضِ وَلاَ فِيْ السَّمَاءِ وَهُوَ السَّمِيْعُ الْعَلِيْمُ 

In the name of Allah, with whose name nothing in the heavens or the earth can cause harm, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.

Abu Dawood, No. 5088; Tirmidhi, No. 3388; Ibn Majah, No. 3869.

content_list.title: Dua for Protection from the Fire of Jahannam
content_list.subtitle: Seven times after Fajr and Maghrib
content_list.content:
If someone recites this dua seven times after Maghrib prayer and dies that night, he will be saved from Jahannam. Similarly, if he recites it seven times after Fajr prayer and dies that day, he will be saved from Jahannam. The dua is:

اللَّهُمَّ أَجِرْنِي مِنَ النَّارِ

O Allah! Protect me from the fire of Jahannam.

Sunan Abu Dawood, 5079

content_list.title: Virtue of the Last Three Verses of Surah Hashr
content_list.subtitle: Seventy thousand angels will be appointed to pray for you
content_list.content:
Ma‘qil ibn Yasar (RA) narrated: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said:

Whoever, upon waking in the morning, says three times:

أَعُوذُ بِاللّٰهِ السَّمِيعِ الْعَلِيمِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيمِ

and then recites the last three verses of Surah Hashr, Allah will appoint seventy thousand angels to pray for him until the evening. If he dies that day, he will die as a martyr. Whoever recites this dua in the evening will receive the same virtue.

[Tirmidhi, Hadith 2922]

The last three verses of Surah Hashr:

هُوَ اللّٰهُ الَّذِیْ لَاۤ اِلٰهَ اِلَّا هُوَ ۚ عٰلِمُ الْغَیْبِ وَ الشَّهَادَةِ ۚ هُوَ الرَّحْمٰنُ الرَّحِیْمُ۝۲۲ هُوَ اللّٰهُ الَّذِیْ لَاۤ اِلٰهَ اِلَّا هُوَ ۚ اَلْمَلِكُ الْقُدُّوْسُ السَّلٰمُ الْمُؤْمِنُ الْمُهَیْمِنُ الْعَزِیْزُ الْجَبَّارُ الْمُتَكَبِّرُ ؕ سُبْحٰنَ اللّٰهِ عَمَّا یُشْرِكُوْنَ۝۲۳ هُوَ اللّٰهُ الْخَالِقُ الْبَارِئُ الْمُصَوِّرُ لَهُ الْاَسْمَآءُ الْحُسْنٰی ؕ یُسَبِّحُ لَهٗ مَا فِی السَّمٰوٰتِ وَ الْاَرْضِ ۚ وَ هُوَ الْعَزِیْزُ الْحَكِیْمُ۠۝۲۴

content_list.title: Dua to Remove All Worries
content_list.subtitle: This dua will remove all your mental worries and restlessness, inshallah
content_list.content:
Whoever recites this dua seven times in the morning and seven times in the evening, Allah will suffice him for all his worldly and hereafter concerns.

حَسْبِيَ اللّٰهُ لَا إِلٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ عَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ وَهُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيْمِ

Allah is sufficient for me; there is no deity except Him. Upon Him I rely, and He is the Lord of the Mighty Throne.

Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 5081. Narrated by Hazrat Abu Darda (RA).

content_list.title: Dua for Becoming the Most Excellent
content_list.content:
Whoever recites this dua 100 times in the morning and 100 times in the evening, no one will bring anything better than him on the Day of Judgment, except the one who does the same or does more.

سُبْحَانَ اللّٰهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ

Meaning: I glorify Allah with His praise.

Muslim, Hadith 2692.

content_list.title: Dua Equivalent to Freeing Ten Slaves and Earning One Hundred Rewards
content_list.content:
Whoever recites this dua 100 times a day, it will be equivalent to freeing ten slaves. One hundred good deeds will be recorded for him, one hundred sins will be erased, and it will protect him from Satan until the evening. No one will bring anything like it on the Day of Judgment, except one who does the same or more. The dua is:

لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللّٰهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ

Meaning: There is no deity except Allah alone, He has no partner, to Him belongs the dominion, to Him belongs all praise, and He is over all things competent.

[Bukhari, Hadith No. 3293; Muslim, Hadith No. 2691]

In another narration, if someone recites this dua once in the morning, it will be equivalent to freeing one Ismaili slave, ten good deeds will be recorded, ten sins will be forgiven, his rank will be elevated by ten degrees, and he will be protected from Satan until the evening. If recited in the evening, he will receive the same reward until the morning. [Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith No. 5079]

In another hadith, reciting it ten times is equivalent to freeing ten slaves. [Nasai, Amalul Yaumi wal Lailah, Hadith No. 24]

content_list.title: Morning and Evening Masnoon Dua 1
content_list.subtitle: Prayer for protection from evil, laziness, and punishment in Hell
content_list.content:
In the morning, recite:

أَصْبَحْنَا وَأَصْبَحَ الْمُلْكُ لِلّٰهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ، لاَ إِلَهَ إلاَّ اللّٰهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ، رَبِّ أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ مَا فِيْ هَذَا الْيَوْمِ وَخَيْرَ مَا بَعْدَهُ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا فِيْ هَذَا الْيَوْمِ وَشَرِّ مَا بَعْدَهُ ، رَبِّ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْكَسَلِ وَسُوءِ الْكِبَرِ، رَبِّ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ فِيْ النَّارِ وَعَذَابٍ فِيْ الْقَبْرِ

We have reached the morning, and the dominion belongs to Allah. All praise is for Allah. There is no deity except Allah alone, He has no partner. To Him belongs the dominion, to Him belongs all praise, and He is over all things competent. O Lord! I ask You for the good of this day and the good that follows it. I seek refuge in You from the evil of this day and the evil that follows it. O Lord! I seek refuge in You from laziness and the evil of old age. O Lord! I seek refuge in You from the punishment of the Fire and the punishment of the grave.

In the evening, recite:

أَمْسَيْنَا وَ أَمْسَىا الْمُلْكُ لِلّٰهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ، لاَ إِلَهَ إلاَّ اللّٰهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ، رَبِّ أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ مَا فِيْ هَذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ وَخَيْرَ مَا بَعْدَهَا، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا فِيْ هَذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ وَشَرِّ مَا بَعْدَهَا، رَبِّ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْكَسَلِ وَسُوءِ الْكِبَرِ، رَبِّ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ فِيْ النَّارِ وَعَذَابٍ فِيْ الْقَبْرِ

We have reached the evening, and the dominion belongs to Allah. All praise is for Allah. There is no deity except Allah alone, He has no partner. To Him belongs the dominion, to Him belongs all praise, and He is over all things competent. O Lord! I ask You for the good of this night and the good that follows it. I seek refuge in You from the evil of this night and the evil that follows it. O Lord! I seek refuge in You from laziness and the evil of old age. O Lord! I seek refuge in You from the punishment of the Fire and the punishment of the grave.

Muslim, No. 2723

content_list.title: Morning and Evening Masnoon Dua 2
content_list.content:
In the morning, say:

اللّٰهُمَّ بِكَ أَصْبَحْنَا، وَبِكَ أَمْسَيْنَا، وَبِكَ نَحْيَا، وَبِكَ نَمُوْتُ وَإِلَيْكَ النُّشُوْرُ

O Allah! By Your blessings, we have reached the morning, and by Your blessings, we reach the evening. You grant us life, and You cause us to die, and to You is the resurrection.

In the evening, say:

اللّٰهُمَّ بِكَ أَمْسَيْنَا، وَبِكَ أَصْبَحْنَا، وَبِكَ نَحْيَا، وَبِكَ نَمُوْتُ، وَإِلَيْكَ الْمَصِيْرُ.

O Allah! By Your blessings, we have reached the evening, and by Your blessings, we reach the morning. You grant us life, and You cause us to die, and to You is the final destination.

Tirmidhi, Hadith No. 3391

content_list.title: Morning and Evening Masnoon Dua 3
content_list.content:
Say three times:

اللّٰهُمَّ عَافِنِيْ فِيْ بَدَنِي، اللّٰهُمَّ عَافِنِيْ فِيْ سَمْعِي، اللّٰهُمَّ عَافِنِيْ فِيْ بَصَرِي، لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ، اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْكُفْرِ، وَالفَقْرِ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابِ القَبْرِ، لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ

O Allah! Grant me safety in my body. O Allah! Grant me safety in my hearing. O Allah! Grant me safety in my sight. There is no deity worthy of worship except You. O Allah! I seek refuge in You from disbelief and poverty, and I seek refuge in You from the punishment of the grave. There is no deity worthy of worship except You.

Abu Dawood, Hadith No. 5092

content_list.title: Morning and Evening Masnoon Dua 4
content_list.content:
يَا حَيُّ يَا قَيُّوْمُ بِرَحْمَتِكَ أَسْتَغِيْثُ أَصْلِحْ لِيْ شَأْنِيَ كُلَّهُ وَلاَ تَكِلْنِيْ إِلَى نَفْسِيْ طَرْفَةَ عَيْنٍ

O Ever-Living, O Self-Sustaining! By Your mercy, I seek help. Rectify all my affairs and do not leave me to myself even for the blink of an eye.

Hakim, Al-Mustadrak, Hadith No. 2000

content_list.title: Dua for Forgiveness of Sins
content_list.subtitle: Even a grave sin like fleeing from the battlefield can be forgiven through this repentance
content_list.content:
The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said, “Whoever recites this dua, Allah will forgive him even if he fled from the battlefield.”

أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللّٰهَ الَّذِيْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ هُوَ الْحَيُّ القَيُّوْمُ وَأَتُوْبُ إِلَيْهِ

I seek forgiveness from Allah, besides whom there is no deity, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence, and I repent to Him.

[Abu Dawood, Hadith No. 1517; Tirmidhi, Hadith No. 3577]

Note: Along with reciting the above phrase, it is essential to repent sincerely from the heart. Only if one seeks forgiveness sincerely with this phrase will he attain the aforementioned reward.

content_list.title: Sayyidul Istighfar - The Best Dua for Forgiveness
content_list.subtitle: Through this istighfar, Allah forgives all sins and grants entry to Jannah
content_list.content:
اَللّٰهُمَّ اَنْتَ رَبِّـيْ لَا اِلٰهَ اِلَّا اَنْتَ خَلَقْتَنِـيْ وَاَنَا عَبْدُكَ وَاَنَا عَلـٰى عَهْدِكَ وَوَعْدِكَ مَا اسْتَطَعْتُ اَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا صَنَعْتُ اَبُوْءُ لَكَ بِنِعْمَتِكَ عَلَيَّ وَاَبُوْءُ لَكَ بِذَنْبِـيْ فَاغْفِرْ لِـيْ فَاِنَّهٗ لَا يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوْبَ اِلَّا اَنْتَ

Meaning: O Allah! You are my Lord. There is no deity except You. You created me, and I am Your servant. I strive to fulfill Your covenant and promise to the best of my ability. I seek refuge in You from the evil of what I have done. I acknowledge Your favor upon me, and I confess my sins to You. So forgive me, for none forgives sins except You.

Virtue: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said, whoever recites this with full faith in the morning and dies before evening will be among the people of Paradise. And whoever recites it in the evening and dies before morning will be among the people of Paradise.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 6306

content_list.title: Dua to Erase Sins Equal to the Foam of the Sea
content_list.subtitle: Through this istighfar, Allah forgives all sins and grants entry to Jannah
content_list.content:
The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said, whoever recites this dua 100 times daily, his sins will be erased, even if they are equal to the foam of the sea.

سُبْحَانَ اللّٰهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ

I glorify Allah with His praise.

Bukhari, Hadith No. 6405; Muslim, Hadith No. 2691

Note: The forgiveness of sins mentioned for these actions applies only to minor sins. For major sins, sincere repentance is necessary.

content_list.title: Dua for Allah’s Pleasure on the Day of Judgment
content_list.content:
Whoever recites this dua three times in the morning and evening, it becomes Allah’s responsibility to please him on the Day of Judgment.

رَضِيْتُ بِاللّٰهِ رَبًّا، وَبِالْإِسْلاَمِ دِيْنًا وَّبِمُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ نَبِيًّا

I am pleased with Allah as my Lord, with Islam as my religion, and with Muhammad (peace be upon him) as my Prophet.

Ahmad, No. 18967; Abu Dawood, No. 1531; Tirmidhi, No. 3389.

content_list.title: Dua for Protection from the Fire of Jahannam
content_list.subtitle: Testimony of Allah’s Oneness and the Prophethood of the Messenger (peace be upon him)
content_list.content:
Whoever recites this dua four times in the morning or evening, Allah will free him from the fire of Jahannam.

In the morning, recite:

اللّٰهُمَّ إِنّيْ أَصْبَحْتُ أُشْهِدُكَ، وَأُشْهِدُ حَمَلَةَ عَرْشِكَ، وَمَلاَئِكَتَكَ، وَجَمِيْعَ خَلْقِكَ، أَنَّكَ أَنْتَ اللّٰهُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ وَحْدَكَ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَكَ، وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُكَ وَرَسُوْلُكَ

O Allah! I have reached the morning, and I call You to witness, and I call the bearers of Your Throne, Your angels, and all Your creation to witness that You are Allah, there is no deity except You alone, with no partner, and that Muhammad (peace be upon him) is Your servant and Messenger.

In the evening, recite:

اللّٰهُمَّ إِنّيْ اَمْسَيْتُ أُشْهِدُكَ، وَأُشْهِدُ حَمَلَةَ عَرْشِكَ، وَمَلاَئِكَتَكَ، وَجَمِيْعَ خَلْقِكَ، أَنَّكَ أَنْتَ اللّٰهُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ وَحْدَكَ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَكَ، وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُكَ وَرَسُوْلُكَ

O Allah! I have reached the evening, and I call You to witness, and I call the bearers of Your Throne, Your angels, and all Your creation to witness that You are Allah, there is no deity except You alone, with no partner, and that Muhammad (peace be upon him) is Your servant and Messenger.

Abu Dawood, Hadith No. 5071; Bukhari, Al-Adabul Mufrad, No. 1201

content_list.title: Dua for Giving Thanks for the Entire Day and Night
content_list.subtitle: Giving thanks to Allah increases His blessings
content_list.content:
Whoever recites this dua in the morning has given thanks for that day, and whoever recites it in the evening has given thanks for that night.

In the morning, recite:

اللّٰهُمَّ مَا أَصْبَحَ بِيْ مِنْ نِعْمَةٍ أَوْ بِأَحَدٍ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ فَمِنْكَ وَحْدَكَ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَكَ، فَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ وَلَكَ الشُّكْرُ

O Allah! Whatever blessing has come to me or any of Your creation this morning is from You alone, with no partner. So to You belongs all praise, and to You belongs all gratitude.

In the evening, recite:

اللّٰهُمَّ مَا اَمْسٰى بِيْ مِنْ نِعْمَةٍ أَوْ بِأَحَدٍ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ فَمِنْكَ وَحْدَكَ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَكَ، فَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ وَلَكَ الشُّكْرُ

O Allah! Whatever blessing has come to me or any of Your creation this evening is from You alone, with no partner. So to You belongs all praise, and to You belongs all gratitude.

Abu Dawood, No. 5075; Nasai, Amalul Yaumi wal Lailah, No. 7.

content_list.title: Four Phrases Heavier than the Worship of the Entire Morning
content_list.content:
سُبْحَانَ اللّٰهِ وَبِحَمْدِهٖ عَدَدَ خَلْقِهٖ وَرِضَا نَفْسِهٖ وَزِنَةَ عَرْشِهٖ وَمِدَادَ كَلِمَاتِهٖ

Meaning: I glorify Allah with His praise, equal to the number of His creation, His pleasure, the weight of His Throne, and the ink of His words.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2726

content_list.title: Dua for Beneficial Knowledge, Pure Sustenance, and Accepted Deeds
content_list.content:
اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَسْأَلُكَ عِلْمًا نَافِعًا، وَرِزْقًا طَيِّبًا، وَعَمَلًا مُتَقَبَّلًا

O Allah! I ask You for beneficial knowledge, pure sustenance, and accepted deeds.

The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) used to recite this dua in the morning.

Ibn Majah, No. 925; Ibnus Sunni, Amalul Yaumi wal Lailah, No. 54.

content_list.title: Protection from Harmful Creatures
content_list.content:
Whoever recites this dua three times in the evening, no poisonous creature will harm him that night.

أَعُوْذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللّٰهِ التَّامَّاتِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ

I seek refuge in the perfect words of Allah from the evil of what He has created.

Ahmad, No. 7898; Tirmidhi, Hadith 3437

content_list.title: Dua for Acceptance of Deeds
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا تَقَبَّلْ مِنَّا إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ السَّمِيْعُ الْعَلِيمُ

Our Lord, accept [this] from us. Indeed, You are the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.

وَتُبْ عَلَيْنَآ إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ التَّوَّابُ الرَّحِيْمُ

And accept our repentance. Indeed, You are the Accepting of Repentance, the Most Merciful.

Surah Al-Baqarah - 2:127-128

content_list.title: Dua for Goodness in This World and the Hereafter
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا آتِنَا فِيْ الدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةً وَّفِيْ الْآخِرَةِ حَسَنَةً وَّقِنَا عَذَابَ النَّارِ

Our Lord, give us in this world [that which is] good and in the Hereafter [that which is] good and protect us from the punishment of the Fire.

Surah Al-Baqarah - 2:201

content_list.title: Dua for Patience, Steadfastness, and Victory
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا أَفْرِغْ عَلَيْنَا صَبْراً وَّثَبِّتْ أَقْدَامَنَا وَانْصُرْنَا عَلَى القَوْمِ الكَافِرِيْنَ

Our Lord, pour upon us patience and plant firmly our feet and give us victory over the disbelieving people.

Surah Al-Baqarah - 2:250

content_list.title: Last Two Verses of Surah Al-Baqarah: Expressing Obedience, Seeking Forgiveness, and Victory
content_list.content:
اٰمَنَ الرَّسُوْلُ بِمَاۤ اُنْزِلَ اِلَیْهِ مِنْ رَّبِّهٖ وَ الْمُؤْمِنُوْنَ ؕ كُلٌّ اٰمَنَ بِاللّٰهِ وَ مَلٰٓىِٕكَتِهٖ وَ كُتُبِهٖ وَ رُسُلِهٖ ۫ لَا نُفَرِّقُ بَیْنَ اَحَدٍ مِّنْ رُّسُلِهٖ ۫ وَ قَالُوْا سَمِعْنَا وَ اَطَعْنَا غُفْرَانَكَ رَبَّنَا وَ اِلَیْكَ الْمَصِیْرُ ۝ لَا یُكَلِّفُ اللّٰهُ نَفْسًا اِلَّا وُسْعَهَا ؕ لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتْ وَ عَلَیْهَا مَا اكْتَسَبَتْ ؕ رَبَّنَا لَا تُؤَاخِذْنَاۤ اِنْ نَّسِیْنَاۤ اَوْ اَخْطَاْنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا وَ لَا تَحْمِلْ عَلَیْنَاۤ اِصْرًا كَمَا حَمَلْتَهٗ عَلَی الَّذِیْنَ مِنْ قَبْلِنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا وَ لَا تُحَمِّلْنَا مَا لَا طَاقَةَ لَنَا بِهٖ ۚ وَ اعْفُ عَنَّا وَ اغْفِرْ لَنَا ۥ وَ ارْحَمْنَا اَنْتَ مَوْلٰىنَا فَانْصُرْنَا عَلَی الْقَوْمِ الْكٰفِرِیْنَ۠ ۝

The Messenger has believed in what was revealed to him from his Lord, and [so have] the believers. All of them have believed in Allah and His angels and His books and His messengers, [saying], 'We make no distinction between any of His messengers.' And they say, 'We hear and we obey. [We seek] Your forgiveness, our Lord, and to You is the [final] destination.' Allah does not burden a soul beyond that it can bear. It will have [the consequence of] what [good] it has gained, and it will bear [the consequence of] what [evil] it has earned. Our Lord, do not impose blame upon us if we have forgotten or erred. Our Lord, and lay not upon us a burden like that which You laid upon those before us. Our Lord, and burden us not with that which we have no ability to bear. And pardon us; and forgive us; and have mercy upon us. You are our protector, so give us victory over the disbelieving people.

Surah Al-Baqarah, 2:285-286

content_list.title: Dua for Steadfastness in Guidance
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا لاَ تُزِغْ قُلُوْبَنَا بَعْدَ إِذْ هَدَيْتَنَا وَهَبْ لَنَا مِنْ لَّدُنْكَ رَحْمَةً إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْوَهَّابُ

Our Lord, let not our hearts deviate after You have guided us and grant us from Yourself mercy. Indeed, You are the Bestower.

Surah Aal-E-Imran, 3:8

content_list.title: Dua for Forgiveness and Protection from Hellfire
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا إِنَّنَا آمَنَّا فَاغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوْبَنَا وَقِنَا عَذَابَ النَّارِ

Our Lord, indeed we have believed, so forgive us our sins and protect us from the punishment of the Fire.

Surah Aal-E-Imran, 3:16

content_list.title: Dua for Righteous Offspring
content_list.content:
رَبِّ هَبْ لِيْ مِنْ لَدُنْكَ ذُرِّيَّةً طَيِّبَةً ۖ إِنَّكَ سَمِيْعُ الدُّعَاءِ

My Lord, grant me from Yourself a good offspring. Indeed, You are the Hearer of supplication.

Surah Aal-E-Imran, 3:38

content_list.title: Dua for Acknowledging Tawheed and Prophethood and Inclusion Among Witnesses
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا آمَنَّا بِمَا اَنْزَلْتَ وَاتَّبَعْنَا الرَّسُوْلَ فَاكْتُبْنَا مَعَ الشَّاهِدِيْنَِ

Our Lord, we have believed in what You revealed and have followed the Messenger, so register us among the witnesses [to truth].

Surah Aal-E-Imran, 3:53

content_list.title: Dua for Forgiveness, Steadfastness, and Victory
content_list.content:
ربَّنَا اغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوْبَنَا وَإِسْرَافَنَا فِيْ أَمْرِنَا وَثَبِّتْ أَقْدَامَنَا وْانْصُرْنَا عَلَى الْقَوْمِ الْكَافِرِيْنَِ

Our Lord, forgive us our sins and the excess [committed] in our affairs and plant firmly our feet and give us victory over the disbelieving people.

Surah Aal-E-Imran, 3:147

content_list.title: Dua for Goodness in the Hereafter
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا مَا خَلَقْتَ هَذا بَاطِلاً سُبْحَانَكَ فَقِنَا عَذَابَ النَّارِ

Our Lord, You did not create this aimlessly; exalted are You [above such a thing]; then protect us from the punishment of the Fire.

رَبَّنَا إِنَّكَ مَنْ تُدْخِلِ النَّارَ فَقَدْ أَخْزَيْتَهُ وَمَا لِلظَّالِمِيْنَ مِنْ أَنْصَارٍ

Our Lord, indeed whoever You admit to the Fire - You have disgraced him, and for the wrongdoers there are no helpers.

رَّبَّنَا إِنَّنَا سَمِعْنَا مُنَادِيًا يُّنَادِيْ لِلْإِيْمَانِ أَنْ آمِنُوْا بِرَبِّكُمْ فَآمَنَّا ۚ رَبَّنَا فَاغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوْبَنَا وَكَفِّرْ عَنَّا سَيِّئَاتِنَا وَتَوَفَّنَا مَعَ الْأَبْرَارِ

Our Lord, indeed we have heard a caller calling to faith, [saying], 'Believe in your Lord,' and we have believed. Our Lord, so forgive us our sins and remove from us our misdeeds and cause us to die with the righteous.

رَبَّنَا وَآتِنَا مَا وَعَدتَّنَا عَلَىٰ رُسُلِكَ وَلَا تُخْزِنَا يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ ۗ إِنَّكَ لَا تُخْلِفُ الْمِيْعَادَ

Our Lord, and grant us what You promised us through Your messengers and do not disgrace us on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed, You do not fail in [Your] promise.

Surah Aal-E-Imran, 3:191-194

content_list.title: Dua of the Oppressed for Help from Allah
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا أَخْرِجْنَا مِنْ هَٰذِهِ الْقَرْيَةِ الظَّالِمِ أَهْلُهَا وَاجْعَلْ لَنَا مِنْ لَدُنْكَ وَلِيًّا وَّاجْعَلْ لَنَا مِنْ لَدُنْكَ نَصِيْرًا

Our Lord, take us out of this city of oppressive people and appoint for us from Yourself a protector and appoint for us from Yourself a helper.

Surah An-Nisa, 4:75

content_list.title: Dua for Forgiveness
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا ظَلَمْنَآ أَنفُسَنَا وَإِنْ لَّمْ تَغْفِرْ لَنَا وَتَرْحَمْنَا لَنَكُوْنَنَّ مِنَ الْخَاسِرِيْنَ

Our Lord, we have wronged ourselves, and if You do not forgive us and have mercy upon us, we will surely be among the losers.

Surah Al-A'raf, 7:23

content_list.title: Dua to Avoid Being Among the Wrongdoers
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا لاَ تَجْعَلْنَا مَعَ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِيْنَ

Our Lord, do not place us with the wrongdoing people.

Surah Al-A'raf, 7:47

content_list.title: Dua for Patience and Death as a Muslim
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا أَفْرِغْ عَلَيْنَا صَبْرًا وَّتَوَفَّنَا مُسْلِمِيْنَ

Our Lord, pour upon us patience and let us die as Muslims [in submission to You].

Surah Al-A'raf, 7:126

content_list.title: Dua for Deliverance from the Trial of the Wrongdoers
content_list.content:
عَلَى اللّٰهِ تَوَكَّلْنَا رَبَّنَا لَا تَجْعَلْنَا فِتْنَةً لِلْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِيْنَ

We rely upon Allah. Our Lord, do not make us [objects of] trial for the wrongdoing people.

وَنَجِّنَا بِرَحْمَتِكَ مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الْكَافِرِيْنَ

And save us by Your mercy from the disbelieving people.

Surah Yunus, 10:85-86

content_list.title: Dua When Boarding a Vessel
content_list.content:
بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ مَجْر۪ىٰهَا وَمُرْسَىٰهَآۚ إِنَّ رَبِّى لَغَفُوْرٌ رَّحِيْمٌ

In the name of Allah is its course and its anchorage. Indeed, my Lord is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah Hud, 11:41

content_list.title: Dua for Oneself and Offspring
content_list.content:
رَبِّ اجْعَلْنِيْ مُقِيْمَ الصَّلَاةِ وَمِنْ ذُرِّيَّتِيْ ۚ رَبَّنَا وَتَقَبَّلْ دُعَاءِ

My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer, and [many] from my descendants. Our Lord, and accept my supplication.

Surah Ibrahim, 14:40

content_list.title: Dua for Forgiveness for Oneself, Parents, and Believers
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا اغْفِرْ لِيْ وَلِوَالِدَيَّ وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِيْنَ يَوْمَ يَقُوْمُ الْحِسَابُ

Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and the believers the Day the account is established.

Surah Ibrahim, 14:41

content_list.title: Dua for Parents
content_list.content:
رَّبِّ ارْحَمْهُمَا كَمَا رَبَّيَانِيْ صَغِيْرًا

My Lord, have mercy upon them as they brought me up [when I was] small.

Surah Al-Isra, 17:24

content_list.title: Dua for Mercy and Right Guidance
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا آتِنَا مِنْ لَّدُنْكَ رَحْمَةً وَّهَيِّئْ لَنَا مِنْ أَمْرِنَا رَشَدًا

Our Lord, grant us from Yourself mercy and prepare for us from our affair right guidance.

Surah Al-Kahf, 18:10

content_list.title: Dua to Remove Speech Impediments
content_list.content:
رَبِّ اشْرَحْ لِيْ صَدْرِيْ وَيَسِّرْ لِيْ أَمْرِيْ وَاحْلُلْ عُقْدَةً مِّنْ لِّسَانِيْ يَفْقَهُوْا قَوْلِيْ

My Lord, expand for me my breast [with assurance] and ease for me my task and untie the knot from my tongue that they may understand my speech.

Surah Taha, 20:25-28

content_list.title: Dua for Increase in Knowledge
content_list.content:
رَّبِّ زِدْنِى عِلْمًا

My Lord, increase me in knowledge.

Surah Taha, 20:114

content_list.title: Dua for Relief from Distress
content_list.content:
أَنِّيْ مَسَّنِيَ الضُّرُّ وَأَنْتَ أَرْحَمُ الرَّاحِمِيْنَ

Indeed, adversity has touched me, and You are the Most Merciful of the merciful.

Surah Al-Anbiya, 21:83

content_list.title: Dua for Offspring
content_list.content:
رَبِّ لَا تَذَرْنِيْ فَرْدًا وَّأَنْتَ خَيْرُ الْوَارِثِيْنَ

My Lord, do not leave me alone [with no heir], while You are the best of inheritors.

Surah Al-Anbiya, 21:89

content_list.title: Dua to Avoid Being Among the Wrongdoers
content_list.content:
رَبِّ فَلَا تَجْعَلْنِيْ فِيْ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِيْنَ

My Lord, do not place me among the wrongdoing people.

Surah Al-Mu'minun, 23:94

content_list.title: Dua for Protection from Satan's Whisperings
content_list.content:
رَّبِّ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ هَمَزَاتِ الشَّيَاطِيْنِ وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ رَبِّ أَنْ يَّحْضُرُوْنِ

My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the incitements of the devils, and I seek refuge in You, my Lord, lest they be present with me.

Surah Al-Mu'minun, 23:97-98

content_list.title: Dua for Forgiveness and Mercy
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا آمَنَّا فَاغْفِرْ لَنَا وَارْحَمْنَا وَأَنْتَ خَيْرُ الرَّاحِمِيْنَ

Our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us and have mercy upon us, and You are the best of the merciful.

Surah Al-Mu'minun, 23:109

content_list.title: Dua for Forgiveness and Mercy
content_list.content:
رَّبِّ اغْفِرْ وَارْحَمْ وَأَنْتَ خَيْرُ الرَّاحِمِيْنَ

My Lord, forgive and have mercy, and You are the best of the merciful.

Surah Al-Mu'minun, 23:118

content_list.title: Dua for Protection from the Punishment of Hell
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا اصْرِفْ عَنَّا عَذَابَ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ إِنَّ عَذَابَهَا كَانَ غَرَامًا

Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Hell. Indeed, its punishment is ever adhering.

Surah Al-Furqan, 25:65

content_list.title: Dua for a Spouse and Offspring that Bring Comfort and Leadership Among the Righteous
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا هَبْ لَنَا مِنْ أَزْوَاجِنَا وَذُرِّيَّاتِنَا قُرَّةَ أَعْيُنٍ وَّاجْعَلْنَا لِلْمُتَّقِيْنَ إِمَامًا

Our Lord, grant us from our spouses and offspring comfort to our eyes and make us an example for the righteous.

Surah Al-Furqan, 25:74

content_list.title: Dua for Wisdom, Good Reputation, and Entry into Paradise
content_list.content:
رَبِّ هَبْ لِيْ حُكْمًا وَّأَلْحِقْنِيْ بِالصَّالِحِيْنَ وَاجْعَل لِّيْ لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ فِيْ الْآخِرِيْنَ وَاجْعَلْنِيْ مِنْ وَّرَثَةِ جَنَّةِ النَّعِيْمِ

My Lord, grant me authority and join me with the righteous. And grant me a reputation of honor among later generations. And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Pleasure.

Surah Ash-Shu'ara, 26:83-85

content_list.title: Dua for Gratitude and Accepted Deeds
content_list.content:
رَبِّ أَوْزِعْنِيْ أَنْ أَشْكُرَ نِعْمَتَكَ الَّتِيْ أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيَّ وَعَلَىٰ وَالِدَيَّ وَأَنْ أَعْمَلَ صَالِحًا تَرْضَاهُ وَأَدْخِلْنِيْ بِرَحْمَتِكَ فِيْ عِبَادِكَ الصَّالِحِيْنَ

My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and to do righteousness of which You approve. And admit me by Your mercy into [the ranks of] Your righteous servants.

Surah An-Naml, 27:19

content_list.title: Dua for Protection from the Wrongdoing People
content_list.content:
رَبِّ نَجِّنِيْ مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِيْنَ

My Lord, save me from the wrongdoing people.

Surah Al-Qasas, 28:21

content_list.title: Dua for Seeking Allah’s Favor
content_list.content:
رَبِّ إِنِّيْ لِمَا أَنْزَلْتَ إِلَيَّ مِنْ خَيْرٍ فَقِيْرٌ

My Lord, indeed I am, for whatever good You would send down to me, in need.

Surah Al-Qasas, 28:24

content_list.title: Dua for Help Against the Corrupt People
content_list.content:
رَبِّ انْصُرْنِيْ عَلَى الْقَوْمِ الْمُفْسِدِيْنَ

My Lord, support me against the corrupting people.

Surah Al-Ankabut, 29:30

content_list.title: Dua for Righteous Offspring
content_list.content:
رَبِّ هَبْ لِيْ مِنَ الصَّالِحِيْنَ

My Lord, grant me [a child] from among the righteous.

Surah As-Saffat, 37:100

content_list.title: Dua for Gratitude, Righteous Deeds, and Righteous Offspring
content_list.content:
رَبِّ أَوْزِعْنِيْ أَنْ أَشْكُرَ نِعْمَتَكَ الَّتِيْ أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيَّ وَعَلَىٰ وَالِدَيَّ وَأَنْ أَعْمَلَ صَالِحًا تَرْضَاهُ وَأَصْلِحْ لِيْ فِيْ ذُرِّيَّتِيْ ۖ إِنِّيْ تُبْتُ إِلَيْكَ وَإِنِّيْ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِيْنَ

My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and to do righteousness of which You approve. And amend for me my offspring. Indeed, I have repented to You, and indeed, I am of the Muslims.

Surah Al-Ahqaf, 46:15

content_list.title: Dua for Forgiveness for Previous Believers and Removal of Enmity from Hearts
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا اغْفِرْ لَنَا وَلِإِخْوَانِنَا الَّذِيْنَ سَبَقُوْنَا بِالْإِيْمَانِ وَلَا تَجْعَلْ فِيْ قُلُوْبِنَا غِلًّا لِّلَّذِيْنَ آمَنُوْا رَبَّنَا إِنَّكَ رَءُوْفٌ رَّحِيْمٌ

Our Lord, forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in faith and put not in our hearts [any] resentment toward those who have believed. Our Lord, indeed You are Kind and Merciful.

Surah Al-Hashr, 59:10

content_list.title: Dua for Completion of Light and Forgiveness
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا أَتْمِمْ لَنَا نُوْرَنَا وَاغْفِرْ لَنَا إِنَّكَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ

Our Lord, perfect for us our light and forgive us. Indeed, You are over all things competent.

Surah At-Tahrim, 66:8

content_list.title: Dua for Reliance on Allah and Acknowledging Return to Him
content_list.content:
رَّبَّنَا عَلَيْكَ تَوَكَّلْنَا وَإِلَيْكَ أَنَبْنَا وَإِلَيْكَ الْمَصِيْرُ

Our Lord, upon You we have relied, and to You we have returned, and to You is the destination.

Surah Al-Mumtahanah, 60:4

content_list.title: Dua for Istikhara Prayer
content_list.subtitle: It is recommended to perform Istikhara before making any permissible decision in worldly matters
content_list.content:
Jabir ibn Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) taught us to seek guidance (Istikhara) in all matters, just as he taught us the chapters of the Quran.

He said: When one of you intends to undertake a matter, let him pray two units (rak'ahs) of voluntary prayer apart from the obligatory prayers, and then say:

اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَسْتَخِيْرُكَ بِعِلْمِكَ، وَأَسْتَقْدِرُكَ بِقُدْرَتِكَ، وَأَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ فَضْلِكَ العَظِيْمِ

O Allah! I seek Your guidance through Your knowledge, and I seek Your strength through Your power, and I ask You from Your immense favor.

فَإِنَّكَ تَقْدِرُ وَلاَ أَقْدِرُ، وَتَعْلَمُ وَلاَ أَعْلَمُ، وَأَنْتَ عَلاَّمُ الغُيُوْبِ

For You have power, and I have none; You know, and I know not; and You are the Knower of the unseen.

اللّٰهُمَّ إِنْ كُنْتَ تَعْلَمُ أَنَّ هَذَا الأمْرَ خَيْرٌ لِيْ فِيْ دِيْنِيْ وَمَعَاشِيْ وَعَاقِبَةِ أَمْرِي، فَاقْدُرْهُ لِيْ وَيَسِّرْهُ لِيْ ثُمَّ بَارِكْ لِيْ فِيْهِ

O Allah! If, in Your knowledge, this matter (mention the matter in mind) is good for my religion, my livelihood, and the outcome of my affairs, then decree it for me, make it easy for me, and bless me in it.

وَإِنْ كُنْتَ تَعْلَمُ أَنَّ هَذَا الْأَمْرَ شَرٌّ لِيْ فِيْ دِيْنِيْ وَمَعَاشِيْ وَعَاقِبَةِ أَمْرِيْ فَاصْرِفْهُ عَنِّيْ وَاصْرِفْنِيْ عَنْهُ وَاقْدُرْ لِيَ الْخَيْرَ حَيْثُ كَانَ، ثُمَّ أَرْضِنِيْ بِهِ

And if, in Your knowledge, this matter is harmful to my religion, my livelihood, and the outcome of my affairs, then turn it away from me and turn me away from it, and decree for me what is good wherever it may be, and make me content with it.

Whoever seeks goodness from the Creator, consults with the believers, and investigates before acting will never regret. For Allah, the Exalted, says:

وَشَاوِرْهُمْ فِيْ الْاَمْرِ ۚ فَاِذَا عَزَمْتَ فَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَيْ اللّٰهِ

Consult them in the matter, and when you have decided, then rely upon Allah. [Surah Aal-E-Imran, 3:159]

[1] Bukhari, 7/162, No. 1162.
[2] Surah Aal-E-Imran, 3:159.

Note:
-------------
After performing the Istikhara prayer, follow the inclination of your heart, as it is considered to be from Allah. If you remain in doubt, you may repeat the prayer multiple times. This prayer can be performed at any time. After the prayer, recite the dua and seek Allah’s help. Then, make a decision based on where your heart leans. Some mistakenly believe Istikhara must be performed before sleeping at night or that a dream is necessary, but these are not required.
Istikhara should be performed for any permissible (halal) matter, such as deciding whether to travel somewhere, buy household items, choose a university or subject, switch jobs, or select a spouse. However, Istikhara is not permissible for deciding whether to perform obligatory acts like marriage or Hajj (e.g., 'Should I ever marry?' or 'Should I perform Hajj?' after it becomes obligatory). It can, however, be used for choosing a Hajj agency or a marriage partner.

content_list.title: Dua for the Newlywed
content_list.content:
بَارَكَ اللّٰهُ لَكَ، وَبَارَكَ عَلَيْكَ، وَجَمَعَ بَيْنَكُمَا فِيْ خَيْرٍ

May Allah bless you and shower His blessings upon you, and unite you both in goodness.

[Abu Dawud, No. 2130; Tirmidhi, No. 1091; Ibn Majah, No. 1905; Nasai, Amalul Yawm wal-Laylah, No. 259.]

content_list.title: Congratulating Someone on the Birth of a Child and Its Response
content_list.content:
بَارَكَ اللّٰهُ لَكَ فِيْ الْمَوْهُوْبِ لَكَ، وَشَكَرْتَ الْوَاهِبَ، وَبَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُ، وَرُزِقْتَ بِرَّهُ

May Allah bless the gift given to you, may you give thanks to the Giver, may the child reach maturity, and may you be granted their righteousness.
[A saying of Hasan Basri, Source: Tuhfatul Mawdud li Ibnil Qayyim, p. 20]

In response, the parent of the child should say:

بَارَكَ اللّٰهُ لَكَ وَبَارَكَ عَلَيْكَ، وَجَزَاكَ اللّٰهُ خَيْراً، وَرَزَقَكَ اللّٰهُ مِثْلَهُ، وَأَجْزَلَ ثَوَابَكَ

May Allah bless you and shower His blessings upon you. May Allah reward you with goodness, grant you the same, and multiply your reward.
[Al-Adhkar, p. 349]

content_list.title: Dua as Expiation at the End of a Gathering
content_list.content:
At the end of a gathering:

۞ سُبْحَانَكَ اللّٰهُمَّ وَبِحَمْدِكَ ، اَشْهَدُ اَنْ لَّا اِلٰهَ اِلَّااَنْتَ اَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وَاَتُوْبُ اِلَيْكَ

Meaning: O Allah! I declare Your purity and praise You. I bear witness that there is no deity but You. I seek Your forgiveness and turn to You in repentance.

Virtue: It is narrated in a hadith that whoever recites this dua at the end of a gathering, their sins from that gathering will be forgiven. [Jami Tirmidhi, Hadith 3433]

۞ Sometimes, at the end of a gathering, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) would supplicate for the companions as follows:

اَللّٰهُمَّ اقْسِمْ لَنَا مِنْ خَشْيَتِكَ مَا يَحُوْلُ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَ مَعَاصِيْكَ ، وَمِنْ طَاعَتِكَ مَا تُبَلِّغُنَا بِهٖ جَنَّتَكَ ، وَمِنَ الْيَقِـيْنِ مَا تُهَوِّنُ بِهٖ عَلَيْنَا مُصِيْبَاتِ الدُّنْيَا ، وَمَتِّعْنَا بِاَسْمَاعِنَا وَاَبْصَارِنَا وَقُوَّتِنَا مَا اَحْيَيْتَنَا ، وَاجْعَلْهُ الْوَارِثَ مِنَّا ، وَاجْعَلْ ثَاْرَنَا عَلٰـى مَنْ ظَلَمَنَا ، وَانْصُرْنَا عَلٰـى مَنْ عَادَانَا ، وَلَا تَجْعَلْ مُصِيْبَتَنَا فِـيْ دِيْنِنَا ، وَلَا تَجْعَلِ الدُّنْيَا اَكْبَرَ هَمِّنَا وَلَا مَبْلَغَ عِلْمِنَا ، وَلَا تُسَلِّطْ عَلَيْنَا مَنْ لَّا يَرْحَمُنَا.

Meaning: O Allah! Grant us such fear of You that prevents us from disobeying You. Grant us such obedience that leads us to Your Paradise. Grant us such certainty that eases the afflictions of this world for us. Allow us to benefit from our hearing, sight, and strength as long as You keep us alive, and make them our heirs. Make our retribution only against those who wrong us, and grant us victory over those who oppose us. Do not let our calamity be in our religion, nor make the world our greatest concern or the extent of our knowledge. And do not impose upon us those who show us no mercy. [Jami Tirmidhi, Hadith 3502]

content_list.title: Dua for Protection from Severe Diseases
content_list.content:
اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْبَرَصِ وَالْجُنُونِ وَالْجُذَامِ وَمِنْ سَيِّئِ الأَسْقَامِ

O Allah! I seek refuge in You from vitiligo, insanity, leprosy, and all severe diseases.

[Abu Dawud 1554, Nasai 5493, Ahmad 12592]

content_list.title: Dua When Fearing an Enemy
content_list.content:
۞ حَسْبُنَا اللهُ وَنِعْمَ الْوَكِيْلُ

Meaning: Allah is sufficient for us, and He is the best disposer of affairs.

Hazrat Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) said: Hazrat Ibrahim (peace be upon him) recited this dua when he was thrown into the fire, and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) recited it when he was threatened by enemies.

۞ اَللّٰهُمَّ اِنَّا نَجْعَلُكَ فِـيْ نُحُوْرِهِمْ وَنَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شُرُوْرِهِمْ

Meaning: O Allah! We place You in front of them, and we seek refuge in You from their evil.

۞ اَللّٰهُمَّ اِلٰهَ جِبْرِيْلَ وَمِيْكَائِيْلَ وَاِسْرَافِيْلَ وَ اِلٰهَ اِبْرَاهِيْمَ وَاِسْمَاعِيْلَ وَاِسْحَاقَ عَافِنِـيْ وَلا تُسَلِّطَنَّ اَحَدًا مِنْ خَلْقِكَ عَلَيَّ بِشَيْءٍ لَا طَاقَةَ لِـيْ بِهِ

Meaning: O Allah! Lord of Jibril, Mikail, and Israfil, Lord of Ibrahim, Ismail, and Ishaq, grant me safety and do not impose upon me any of Your creation with something I cannot bear.

۞ During the Hijrah, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) recited this dua out of fear of attack by the Quraysh:

اَللّٰهُمَّ اكْفِنَاهُ بِمَا شِئْتَ

Meaning: O Allah! Be sufficient for us against them however You will.

content_list.title: Dua When Fearing Oppression from a Ruler
content_list.content:
