۞ اَللّٰهُمَّ رَبَّ السَّمَاوَاتِ السَّبْعِ ، وَرَبَّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيْمِ ، كُنْ لِـيْ جَارًا مِنْ فُلَانِ بْنِ فُلَانٍ وَاَحْزَابِهٖ مِنْ خَلَائِقِكَ ، اَنْ يَفْرُطَ عَلَيَّ اَحَدٌ مِنْهُمْ اَوْ يَطْغٰى ، عَزَّ جَارُكَ ، وَجَلَّ ثَنَاؤُكَ ، وَلَا اِلٰهَ اِلَّا اَنْتَ

Meaning: O Allah! Lord of the seven heavens and Lord of the Mighty Throne, be my protector against so-and-so, son of so-and-so, and his allies among Your creation, so that none of them may transgress against me or oppress me. Your protection is mighty, Your praise is exalted, and there is no deity but You.

Virtue: Hazrat Abdullah ibn Mas’ud (may Allah be pleased with him) said: If anyone fears oppression from a ruler, let them recite this dua.

[Bukhari, Al-Adab Al-Mufrad, No. 707]

content_list.title: Dua Against Enemies
content_list.content:
اللّٰهُمَّ مُنْزِلَ الْكِتَابِ، سَرِيْعَ الْحِسَابِ، اهْزِمِ الأَحْزَابَ، اللّٰهُمَّ اهزِمْهُمْ وَزَلْزِلْهُمْ

Meaning: O Allah! Revealer of the Book, Swift in reckoning, defeat the confederates. O Allah! Defeat them and shake them.

The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) supplicated against the enemies during the Battle of the Trench.

[Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 2933]

content_list.title: Dua for Someone Doubting Their Faith 1
content_list.content:
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: If Satan comes to one of you and says, 'Who created this? Who created that?' until he says, 'Who created your Lord?' When someone reaches this point (and doubts arise in their faith), they should seek refuge with Allah and refrain from such thoughts. [Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 3576]

Dua to seek refuge from Satan:

أَعُوْذُ بِاللّٰهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيْمِ

I seek refuge with Allah from the accursed Satan.

content_list.title: Dua for Someone Doubting Their Faith 2
content_list.content:
هُوَ الْأوَّلُ وَالْآخِرُ وَالظّاهِرُ وَالْبَاطِنُ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيْمٌ

He is the First and the Last, the Outward and the Inward, and He is All-Knowing of everything.

[Abu Dawud 4/329, No. 5112]

content_list.title: Dua to Ward Off Satan and His Whispers
content_list.content:
Seek refuge with Allah from him:

أَعُوْذُ بِاللّٰهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيْمِ

I seek refuge with Allah from the accursed Satan.

[Ibn Majah, No. 807]

content_list.title: Dua for Protection from Shirk
content_list.content:
اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ أَنْ أُشْرِكَ بِكَ وَأَنَا أَعْلَمُ، وَأَسْتَغْفِرُكَ لِمَا لاَ أَعْلَمُ

O Allah! I seek refuge in You from knowingly associating partners with You, and I seek Your forgiveness for what I do unknowingly.

[Ahmad, No. 19606]

content_list.title: Dua When Visiting the Sick
content_list.content:
۞ لَا بَاْسَ طَهُوْرٌ اِنْ شَاءَ اللهُ

Meaning: No harm, it is a purification, if Allah wills. [Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 3616]

۞ اَسْاَلُ اللهَ الْعَظِيْمَ رَبَّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيْمِ اَنْ يَشْفِيَكَ

Meaning: I ask Allah, the Mighty, Lord of the Mighty Throne, to cure you. (Recite this seven times.)

It is narrated in a hadith that if someone visits a sick person and recites this dua seven times, Allah will cure them unless their death is imminent. [Sunan Abu Dawud, Hadith 3108]

۞ اَذْهِبِ الْبَاسَ رَبَّ النَّاسِ ، اِشْفِ وَاَنْتَ الشَّافِـيْ لَا شِفَاءَ اِلَّاشِفَاؤُكَ شِفَاءً لَا يُغَادِرُ سَقَمًا

Meaning: O Lord of mankind, remove the affliction and grant healing, for You are the Healer. There is no healing except Your healing, a healing that leaves no trace of illness. [Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5675]

۞ بِاسْمِ اللهِ اَرْقِـيْكَ مِنْ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ يُؤْذِيْكَ مِنْ شَرِّ كُلِّ نَفْسٍ اَوْ عَيْنِ حَاسِدٍ ، اَللهُ يَشْفِيْكَ ، بِاسْمِ اللهِ اَرْقِـيْكَ

Meaning: In the name of Allah, I recite over you for protection from everything that harms you, from the evil of every soul or envious eye. May Allah heal you. In the name of Allah, I recite over you.

It is narrated that when the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) fell ill, Hazrat Jibril (peace be upon him) recited this dua over him. [Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2186]

content_list.title: Dua for Visiting the Grave
content_list.content:
۞ اَلسَّلَامُ عَلَيْكُمْ يَا اَهْلَ القُبُوْرِ يَغْفِرُ اللهُ لَنَا وَلَكُمْ اَنْتُمْ سَلَفُنَا وَنَحْنُ بِالْاَثَرِ

Meaning: Peace be upon you, O dwellers of the graves. May Allah forgive us and you. You are our predecessors, and we are following in your footsteps. [Jami Tirmidhi, Hadith 1053]

۞ Or:

اَلسَّلَامُ عَلَيْكُمْ دَارَ قَوْمٍ مُؤْمِنِيْنَ وَاِنَّا اِنْ شَاءَ اللهُ بِكُمْ لَاحِقُوْنَ

Meaning: Peace be upon you, O abode of the believers. If Allah wills, we will join you. [Sahih Muslim, Hadith 249]

۞ Or:

السَّلاَمُ عَلَيْكُمْ أَهْلَ الدِّيَارِ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُسْلِمِينَ وَإِنَّا إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ لَلاَحِقُونَ أَسْأَلُ اللَّهَ لَنَا وَلَكُمُ الْعَافِيَةَ

Meaning: Peace be upon you, O dwellers of these abodes, believers and Muslims. If Allah wills, we will join you. I ask Allah for safety for us and for you. [Sahih Muslim, Hadith 975]

content_list.title: Dua When Feeling Pain in the Body
content_list.content:
بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ اَعُوْذُ بِعِزَّةِ اللّٰهِ وَقُدْرَتِهِ , مِنْ شَرِّ مَا اَجِدُ وَاُحَاذِرُ

Meaning: In the name of Allah, I seek refuge in the might and power of Allah from the evil of what I feel and fear.

Benefit: Place your right hand on the affected area and recite this dua seven times. Hazrat Uthman ibn Abul As (may Allah be pleased with him) said: I was afflicted with pain and went to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him). He told me to place my right hand on the affected area and recite this dua seven times. I did so, and Allah healed me. [Sunan Ibn Majah, Hadith 3522]

content_list.title: Dua for Deliverance from Calamity
content_list.content:
When facing any calamity or distressing event:

۞ اِنَّا لِلّٰهِ وَاِنَّا اِلَيْهِ رَاجِعُوْنَ

Meaning: Indeed, to Allah we belong, and to Him we shall return. [Surah Al-Baqarah, 2:156]

۞ اِنَّا لِلّٰهِ وَاِنَّا اِلَيْهِ رَاجِعُوْنَ اَللّٰهُمَّ اْجُرْنِـيْ فِـيْ مُصِيْبَتِـيْ وَاَخْلِفْ لِـيْ خَيْرًا مِنْهَا

Meaning: Indeed, to Allah we belong, and to Him we shall return. O Allah! Reward me in my calamity and replace it with something better. [Sahih Muslim, Hadith 918]

For relief from debt, sorrow, and anxiety:

۞ اَللّٰهُمَّ اِنِّـيْ اَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْهَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ وَاَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْعَجْزِ وَالْكَسَلِ وَاَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْجُبْنِ وَالْبُخْلِ وَاَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ غَلَبَةِ الدَّيْنِ وَقَهْرِ الرِّجَالِ

Meaning: O Allah! I seek refuge in You from anxiety and sorrow, from weakness and laziness, from cowardice and miserliness, and from the burden of debt and the oppression of men.
Recite this in the morning and evening. [Sunan Abu Dawud, Hadith 1557]

۞ لَا اِلٰهَ اِلَّا اللهُ الْعَظِيْمُ الْحَلِيْمُ لَا اِلٰهَ اِلَّا اللهُ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيْمِ لَا اِلٰهَ اِلَّا اللهُ رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَرَبُّ الْاَرْضِ وَرَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْكَرِيْمِ

Meaning: There is no deity but Allah, the Mighty, the Forbearing. There is no deity but Allah, Lord of the Mighty Throne. There is no deity but Allah, Lord of the heavens, Lord of the earth, and Lord of the Honorable Throne.
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) recited this dua during calamities. [Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 6346]

For relief from debt:

۞ اَللّٰهُمَّ اكْفِنِـيْ بِحَلَالِكَ عَنْ حَرَامِكَ ، وَاَغْنِنِـيْ بِفَضْلِكَ عَنْ مَّنْ سِوَاكَ

Meaning: O Allah! Make Your lawful provisions sufficient for me so that I may avoid the unlawful, and make me independent of others through Your grace.

Virtue: It is narrated that reciting this dua will prompt Allah to arrange for the repayment of even a mountain of debt. [Jami Tirmidhi, Hadith 3563]

To remove calamity and ease difficult tasks:

۞ لَا اِلٰهَ اِلَّااَنْتَ سُبْحَانَكَ اِنِّـيْ كُنْتُ مِنَ الظَّالِمِيْنَ

Meaning: There is no deity but You. Glorified are You. Indeed, I have been among the wrongdoers.
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: When a Muslim recites this dua, their supplication is accepted. [Jami Tirmidhi, Hadith 3505]

۞ اَللّٰهُمَّ لَا سَهْلَ اِلَّا مَا جَعَلْتَهٗ سَهْلًا ، وَاَنْتَ تَجْعَلُ الْحَزَنَ اِذَا شِئْتَ سَهْلًا

Meaning: O Allah! Nothing is easy except what You make easy, and You make the difficult easy when You will. [Bayhaqi, Ad-Da’watul Kabir, Hadith 265]

۞ اَللّٰهُمَّ الْطُفْ بِـيْ فِـيْ تَيْسِيْرِ كُلِّ عَسِيْرٍ فَاِنَّ تَيْسِيْرَ كُلِّ عَسِيْرٍ عَلَيْكَ يَسِيْرٌ وَاَسْاَلُكَ الْيُسْرَ وَالْمُعَافَاةَ فِـيْ الدُّنْيَا وَالْاٰخِرَةِ

Meaning: O Allah! Be kind to me by making every difficulty easy, for making every difficulty easy is easy for You. I ask You for ease and safety in this world and the Hereafter. [Al-Jamius Saghir, Hadith 1527]

۞ لَا اِلٰهَ اِلَّااللهُ الْحَلِيْمُ الْكَرِيْمُ ، سُبْحَانَ اللهِ وَتَبَارَكَ اللهُ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيْمِ ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِيْنَ

Meaning: There is no deity but Allah, the Forbearing, the Generous. Glorified is Allah, and blessed is Allah, Lord of the Mighty Throne. All praise is for Allah, Lord of the worlds.
Hazrat Abdullah ibn Jafar (may Allah be pleased with him) would recite these words and blow over someone with a fever. [Musnad Ahmad, Hadith 701]

۞ اَللّٰهُمَّ اِنِّـيْ عَبْدُكَ، وَابْنُ عَبْدِكَ، وَابْنُ اَمَتِكَ، نَاصِيَتِـيْ بِيَدِكَ، مَاضٍ فِـيَّ حُكْمُكَ، عَدْلٌ فِـيَّ قَضَاؤُكَ، اَسْاَلُكَ بِكُلِّ اسْمٍ هُوَ لَكَ، سَمَّيْتَ بِهٖ نَفْسَكَ، اَوْ اَنْزَلْتَهٗ فِـيْ كِتَابِكَ، اَوْ عَلَّمْتَهٗ اَحَدًا مِّنْ خَلْقِكَ، اَوِ اسْتَاْثَرْتَ بِهٖ فِـيْ عِلْمِ الْغَيْبِ عِنْدَكَ، اَنْ تَجْعَلَ الْقُرْاٰنَ رَبِيْعَ قَلْبِـيْ، وَنُوْرَ بَصَرِيْ، وَجِلَاءَ حُزْنِـيْ، وَذَهَابَ هَمِّـيْ

Meaning: O Allah! I am Your servant, son of Your servant, son of Your maidservant. My forelock is in Your hand, Your command over me is fulfilled, and Your judgment upon me is just. I ask You by every name belonging to You, which You have named Yourself, revealed in Your Book, taught to any of Your creation, or kept in the knowledge of the unseen with You, to make the Quran the spring of my heart, the light of my eyes, the relief of my sorrow, and the remover of my anxiety. [Al-Mu’jamul Kabir, Hadith 10198]

۞ اَللّٰهُمَّ رَحْمَتَكَ اَرْجُوْ فَلَا تَكِلْنِـيْ اِلٰـى نَفْسِـيْ طَرْفَةَ عَيْنٍ ، وَاَصْلِحْ لِـيْ شَاْنِـيْ كُلَّهُ لَا اِلٰهَ اِلَّااَنْتَ

Meaning: O Allah! I hope for Your mercy, so do not leave me to myself even for the blink of an eye, and rectify all my affairs. There is no deity but You.

Benefit: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: This is the dua of a person in distress. [Sunan Abu Dawud, Hadith 5092]

When facing calamity:

لَا اِلٰهَ اِلَّااللهُ الْحَلِيْمُ الْكَرِيْمُ ، سُبْحَانَ اللهِ رَبِّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيْمِ ، سُبْحَانَ اللهِ رَبِّ السَّمَاوَاتِ السَّبْعِ ، وَرَبِّ الْعَرْشِ الْكَرِيْمِ

Meaning: There is no deity but Allah, the Forbearing, the Generous. Glorified is Allah, Lord of the Mighty Throne. Glorified is Allah, Lord of the seven heavens and Lord of the Honorable Throne. [Sunan Ibn Majah, Hadith 3883]

content_list.title: Dua When Fearing a Calamity
content_list.content:
اَللّٰهُمَّ اِنِّـيْ اَسْاَلُكَ الْعَافِيَةَ فِـيْ الدُّنْيَا وَالْاٰخِرَةِ ، اَللّٰهُمَّ اِنِّـيْ اَسْاَلُكَ الْعَفْوَ وَالْعَافِيَةَ فِـيْ دِيْنِـيْ وَدُنْيَايَ وَاَهْلِـيْ وَمَالِـيْ ، اَللّٰهُمَّ اسْتُرْ عَوْرَاتِـيْ ، وَاٰمِنْ رَوْعَاتِـيْ ، اَللّٰهُمَّ احْفَظْنِـيْ مِنْ بَيْنِ يَدَيَّ ، وَمِنْ خَلْفِـيْ ، وَعَنْ يَمِيْنِـيْ ، وَعَنْ شِمَالِـيْ ، وَمِنْ فَوْقِـيْ ، وَاَعُوْذُ بِعَظَمَتِكَ اَنْ اُغْتَالَ مِنْ تَحْتِـيْ

Meaning: O Allah! I ask You for safety in this world and the Hereafter. O Allah! I ask You for forgiveness and safety in my religion, my worldly affairs, my family, and my wealth. O Allah! Conceal my faults and secure me from my fears. O Allah! Protect me from in front of me, behind me, on my right, on my left, and above me. I seek refuge in Your greatness from being overtaken from below.

content_list.title: Dua to Suppress Anger
content_list.content:
أَعُوْذُ بِاللّٰهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيْمِ

I seek refuge with Allah from the accursed Satan.

[Bukhari, No. 3282; Muslim, No. 2610]

content_list.title: Dua When Seeing Someone Afflicted or in Distress
content_list.content:
اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ الَّذِيْ عَافَانِيْ مِمَّا ابْتَلاَكَ بِهِ، وَفَضَّلَنِيْ عَلَى كَثِيْرٍ مِمَّنْ خَلَقَ تَفْضِيْلاً

All praise is for Allah, Who has protected me from what He has afflicted you with and favored me over many of His creation.

[Tirmidhi, No. 3432]

content_list.title: What to Say When Encountering Something Pleasing or Displeasing
content_list.content:
When something pleasing came to the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him), he would say:

اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ الَّذِيْ بِنِعْمَتِهِ تَتِمُّ الصَّالِحَاتُ

All praise is for Allah, by Whose blessings righteous deeds are completed.

When something displeasing came to him, he would say:

اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ عَلَى كُلِّ حَالٍ

All praise is for Allah in every situation.

[Ibnus Sunni, Amalul Yawm wal-Laylah, No. 377]

content_list.title: Dua for Someone You Have Insulted
content_list.content:
اللّٰهُمَّ فَأَيُّمَا مُؤْمِنٍ سَبَبْتُهُ فَاجْعَلْ ذَلِكَ لَهُ قُرْبَةً إِلَيْكَ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ

O Allah! For any believer I have insulted, make it a means of nearness to You for them on the Day of Resurrection.

[Bukhari, No. 6361]

content_list.title: Dua After Accepting an Invitation to Eat
content_list.content:
۞ اَكَلَ طَعَامَكُمُ الْاَبْرَارُ ، وَصَلَّتْ عَلَيْكُمُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ ، وَاَفْطَرَ عِنْدَكُمُ الصَّائِمُوْنَ

Meaning: May the righteous eat your food, may the angels pray for you, and may those fasting break their fast at your place. [Musnad Ahmad, Hadith 12406]

This dua can also be recited when someone provides iftar.

۞ اَللّٰهُمَّ اَطْعِمْ مَنْ اَطْعَمَنِـيْ ، وَاسْقِ مَنْ سَقَانِـيْ

Meaning: O Allah! Feed the one who fed me, and give drink to the one who gave me drink.

[Musnad Ahmad, Hadith 23809]
